job_title: VP, Senior Quantitative Analyst, Grp Market Making, Global Markets
company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. This work is done in collaboration with the Risk and IT departments.

About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.
NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).
Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
job_description:
The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant. 
The provision of safe drinking water is of upmost national importance. Engineered water systems (such as drinking water distribution and HVAC systems) contain consortia of microorganisms and extracellular polymeric substances referred to as biofilms. Biofilms have been shown to harbor a broad variety of microorganisms associated with corrosion of the pipe material, lead to the breakdown of residual disinfectants like monochloramine, and are known to support the growth of opportunistic waterborne pathogens. In previous projects, an array of sensor nodes was established wirelessly in the drinking water distribution networks (DWDS) of two campuses in Singapore, measuring water quality and leak-detection associated parameters in real-time, and providing easy access to the network. More recently, a simulated Intermittent Water Distribution system and laboratory scale HVAC / chiller unit circles have been established and will be the foundation of in-depth research into the impact of hydraulic and physicochemical conditions on the formation of potentially hazardous biofilms and their microbial composition.
We are looking for a self-driven, committed, and inquisitive Data Analyst to join our drinking water distribution team at SCELSE. In addition to the in-depth analysis and visualization of data obtained from the various operational and simulated water systems, the candidate will develop and validate molecular assays (generating positive and negative controls, designing, and calculating standard curves, determining recovery rates and inhibition factors) and microfluidic-based methods to detect bacterial indicator organisms. The candidate will also be involved in laboratory and field operations such as biofilm and bulk water sampling as well as housekeeping tasks such as ongoing quality control for the methods used. A wide array of novel techniques will be used (e.g., whole genome and 16S rRNA metabarcoding sequencing and microfluidic flow cytometry) and the candidate will get insights into their application in a public health-related critical infrastructure.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • Planning, organizing, and conducting outdoor sampling of three well-established DWDS testbeds to understand the impact of operational events on drinking water quality.
  • Analyzing water quality parameters
  • Application of a wide array of novel molecular techniques and methods (e.g., next generation sequencing and high-sensitivity flow cytometry) for the analysis of samples collected in DWDS
  • Validation and maintenance of quality control for current workflow based on advanced bioinformatical approaches
  • Application of a wide variety of data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python and Graphpad) to gain insights into microbial communities in water and their relationships with physicochemical water quality parameters
  • Interpretation and visualization of complex data sets
 
Job Requirements: 
  • BSc in environmental engineering, data analysis or related disciplines.
  • Advanced knowledge in collecting data, data processing and laboratory techniques.
  • Basic understanding of biofilm biology, its relevance and detection methods.
  • Experience in setting up and maintaining remote sensing equipment as well as experimental testbeds.
  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving.
  • Experience in flow cytometry.
  • Experience in analyzing large datasets using R, working independently, and data modeling  
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company_overview:
Information Technology

Established in 1996, CyberQuote Pte Ltd (CQ) provides a holistic range of products and services in the area of financial technology solutions and financial training.

CQ has experience and expertise in providing various IT solutions and services to the stock broking and insurance industry. CQ has notably played a major role in developing Singapore’s first online share trading platform, Phillip Online Electronic Mart Systems (POEMS).

From there CQ has branched out its service to IT Securities consultation & training.

We focus on security, usability, communication and marketing requirements of our clients and endeavor to deliver solutions to clients that help them retain leadership position in their respective categories.
Education

With more than 18 years of track record in the financial industry, CyberQuote (“CQ”) has built a reputable name among the financial players as a quality training institution.

Over the years, as the financial market evolved, trading and investment strategies have become more sophisticated. Education and training are now essential for investors and finance professionals. Looking ahead of changes, CQ constantly develops and enhances our range of courses, seminars and workshop for novices, professional traders and investors. This will equip them with knowledge, know-how and skills to trade diligently.
In CQ’s lifelong learning stratagem, we believe that knowledge, theories, experiences and skills are valuable tools for successful trading. Our trainers regularly undertake coaching assignment in trading. Hence they’re able to deliver ideas, systems and methods to the participants.

In CQ we believe in the importance of equipping our investors and professional traders with the right tools to grow their investments. Our trainers adopt practical teaching approach with close references to industry practices and examples to make learning process more enjoyable.

company_overview:
Schaeffler Group – We pioneer motion

As a leading global supplier to the automotive and industrial sectors, the Schaeffler Group has been driving forward groundbreaking inventions and developments in the fields of motion and mobility for over 75 years.

With innovative technologies, products, and services for electric mobility, CO2-efficient drives, Industry 4.0, digitalization, and renewable energies, the company is a reliable partner for making motion and mobility more efficient, intelligent, and sustainable. job_description:
The role will be responsible for the operative material data creation and maintenance for Demand Management in Industrial Asia Pacific to secure the operative business for Trading Plants including Regional Levelling Points, Distribution Centers and Satellite Distribution Centers. He/she will be responsible for relevant data quality indicators and process KPIs based on global rules in Industrial Asia Pacific.

Key Responsibilities

Operative Material Data Management 

  • Release and processing of RfMM (Request for Material Master) workflows in SAP_EP1
  • Manual creation of material data in SAP_P66
  • Material Purchasing Data creation, including Purchase Info Record (PIR), PREF, Quality Info Record (QIR) and Vendor List
  • Definition and maintanence of Field Entry Documentation (FED) rules
  • Maintenance of data and improvement of the material data quality
  • Support and execution of group-wide changes in Material Data for Industrial Asia Pacific Trading Plants for e.g. SOCO Master Data Fixation 
  • Identification of master data inconsistencies inside and outside the Industrial Asia network
  • Requesting master data changes and tracking outside of the Industrial Asia Pacific network
  • Execution of product replacements and relocations within the system to ensure fulfilment of the global product management strategy

Schaeffler Quality Initiatives & KPIs

  • Responsible for the monitoring and achievement of relevant process KPIs/Data Quality Indicators for material data including RfMM, DQ-MMR PlanMats (Data Quality of relevant Material Master Record fields for Demand Planning materials), Material Status Release and MDSC/DQ-DC & DQC etc., for Industrial Asia Pacific Trading Plants and to define improvement activities in case of any deviations

Project Management

  • Implementation of projects in the context of continuous improvement process and quality management
  • Support and particiapte in (sub-)projects with focus on Demand Management Material Data
  • Alignment with process owner regarding extensive process changes or requirements 

Pre-requisites

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration (specialization on Supply Chain Management) or relevant field
  • Minimum of 1-3 years professional experience in the related field of Material Data Management
  • Proficient in SAP-R/3 (MM, PP, SD Modules) and Microsoft office applications
  • Detailed oriented to ensure data accuracy within SAP system based on defined guidelines
  • Team player and able to communicate effectively

Note:

We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Please state your current and expected salary in the resume.

job_title: SVP / VP, Data Architecture / Data Management --- [[WD25395)
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
SVP / VP, Data Architecture / Data Management - Product Owner, Transformation Group - (WD25395)

Business Function
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! 
Responsibilities
As a specialist in Data Architecture and Data Management in the DBS Data Platform Business team, you will drive the definition of relevant practices and adoption of best-in-class solutions to drive adherence to the bank standards and empower data producers/consumers to deliver greater business outcomes with the Data Platform.
  • Define data management principles and guidelines for the various patterns of usage of DBS Data Platform, covering areas such as business data architecture, metadata, data security, data quality and reference data.
  • Govern adherence to data management principles by project implementation teams and components of the data platform.
  • Function as a Product Owner to operationalise data management principles and other data management initiatives, defining requirements and collaborating with Technology teams to implement solutions and embed them into the data delivery lifecycle.
  • Identify areas of improvements and explore opportunities to adopt emerging data management practices and technologies, experimenting solutions and developing business cases to open the way for effective adoption.
  • Contribute to shape the future of DBS Data Platform, engage with stakeholders across the organisation to develop forward-thinking approaches and solutions.
Requirements
  • At least 10 years of experience in related fields including at least 5 years in data architecture/data management roles. Experience in banking industry would be an advantage.
  • Broad exposure to data architecture/data management practices and challenges involved in building modern data and analytics platforms, in areas such as metadata, reference data, data security, data quality.
  • Experience in a product ownership or product management role, excellent project leadership and execution skills: set up a vision and strategy, define requirements and priorities (user stories), coordinate with stakeholders and manage expectations, manage planning and risks, drive adoption of solutions etc.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, proficient in PowerPoint & Excel, clear ability to articulate messages and develop presentations for senior management.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
job_requirement_qualification: Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_description:
How Will You Make an Impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com
What will you do?
When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team, and help us make significant contributions to the world.
Responsibilities and Authorities
  • As local ERP team member to provide tailor made solution to cater for the rapid changing demand from business.
  • Provide end to end daily supporting, mainly focus on Oracle EBS order management, supply chain & Finance module and surrounding systems like Master Control, PDM & warehouse scanner etc.
  • Co-work with global IT, other local IT teams and stakeholders in BU to roll out global projects into Singapore.
  • Independently to finish gap analysis, proposal for any new request. Manage the following progress and delivery quality, conducting UAT, end user training, etc.
  • Review and optimize business process, synergize the best practice across the Business Units
  • Improve local user’s Oracle EBS knowledge by delivery regular specific training in accordance with BU’S business feature.
  • Standardize local user’s operation in Oracle EBS with SOP documentation.
  • This role will grow into an IT site lead role in future as the SUD Singapore business continues to grow over the coming years
Qualification
  • Individuals with bachelor's degree in computer science
  • Solid knowledge in finance/accounting area is preferred
  • PMP certification is a plus
Experiences
  • Experiences / Years of Experience
  • Work experience 6
  • Master in Oracle EBS Finance module 3+
  • Good background in oracle EBS distribution (OM, INV, MRP, WIP, BOM, PO, QA) modules 3+
  • Good knowledge in Oracle SQL queries. 3+
Competencies Preferred
  • Good skills in spoken and written English, with open and professional communication style
  • Self-motivated, proactive and independent
  • Mature, committed, good working attitude and interpersonal skills
  • Business and service oriented, good attitude with desire to cooperate
  • Willing to work under pressure and independently

company_overview: Petron Singapore Trading Pte. Ltd. (PSTPL) was incorporated on May 13, 2010 and started its operations on July 19, 2010.  PSTPL is the regional trading arm of Petron Corporation, the largest refining and marketing company in the Philippines, supplying more than a third of the country’s oil requirements.  PSTPL handles crude imports and trading of different petroleum and petrochemical products.
job_description:
Responsibilities

  • Implements import and export contracts of petroleum and petrochemical products through preparation of required internal and external documents, and coordinates with all concerned parties thereby ensuring that an incoming shipment complies with internal requirements, operating standards, and relevant regulations
  • Monitors shipment/vessel status and sends updates to concerned parties
  • Negotiates terms for Letters of Credit with counterparties
  • Calculates pricing, arranges invoices, prepares SAP entries and monitors cargo payments
  • Prepares demurrage computation for timely submission, follow up for collection to counterparties
  • Prepares weekly Demurrage Status Report to monitor pending demurrage claims
  • Handles the chartering operations of shipments with PSTPL chartered vessels
  • Issues voyage orders
  • Checks freight invoice and endorses to Management and Finance for approval and payment
  • Monitors vessel status and sends updates to concerned parties
  • Maintains timely and accurate records
  • Any other duties as assigned by the Management

Requirements:

  • Degree in Engineering or Business
  • 2 – 3 years experience in oil trading operations
  • Must have experience in logistics, shipping or any other related fields
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Bilingual in English and Mandarin (In order to handle and negotiate with the Mandarin speaking counterparties in regards with the shipment operation)
  • Highly organized, meticulous and able to multi-task
  • Willing to work long hours as necessary
  • Able to respond to operational matters after office hours and non-working days as necessary

job_description:
Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients. Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development.
Job Scope:
  • Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements.
  • Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using excellent communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements.
  • Research, identify, and specify solutions to problems.
  • Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.
  • Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.
  • Support requirements management and change management processes.
  • Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.
  • Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.
Job Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of 2 to 6 years related experience in Business Analyst capacity
  • Equivalent experience in: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.
  • Good verbal and written communication skill and is comfortable fronting client
  • Ability to work effectively in a team
Interested candidates can click apply for more information.

job_description:
Job Duties:
  • Responsible for planning, scheduling and coordinating demand/supply management, business processes and/or manufacturing/delivery of products and services to company policy and country regulatory requirements.
  • Partners with stakeholders to identify/implement opportunities for business process improvement to effectively manage costs, integrate new and existing businesses, and adapt to changes in the business and regulatory environment.
  • Time horizon is typically focused on less than six months for forecasting/planning.
  • Leading and working with cross-functional teams, creates and implements plans that enable the execution of business strategies.
  • Participates in the process by which demand signals are developed, validated for alignment with transition plans, supply constraints identified, and an executable plan defined that meets financial and market share goals.
  • Scope includes business execution processes related to lifecycle planning; order management (including allocation management,
  • Available to Promise (ATP) / commit processes, business attainment tracking); logistics management (including inbound/outbound coordination and consolidation of domestic and international systems to support shipments); and inventory management (including analysis, optimization and velocity).

  • Typically 2 to 4 years of experience in a supply chain function.

  • Applicants must be willing to work in Alexander.

  • Contract position(s) available.

job_title: AVP / Senior Assoc, Market & Counter-party Risk Business Analyst -- \WD23713)
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function
Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. 
Responsibilities
  • Undertake the business analyst role for Market & Counterparty Risk Domain.
  • Gather, collate and analyse user' requirements from business and risk users including data science related requests and provide clear business specifications for implementations to Market & Counterparty Risk Systems.
  • Analyse and perform impact analysis of requests and review system and functional designs are sound and adequate to address Market & Counterparty Risk Business needs.
  • Devise comprehensive test plans (including test scenarios and test cases) to test system deliverables.
  • Perform User Acceptance Testing, Regression Testing, Simulation Testing and Live verifications to ensure system deliveries meet requirements objectives.
  • Plan, schedule and adhere to enhancement timeliness to meet agreed deliverables.
  • Work with digital team comprising of data scientists and data engineer to drive and experiment various digital initiatives for risk domain.
 Requirements
  • Degree in Banking, Financial Engineering, Computer Science or any other related quantitative discipline with about 5 to 8 years' relevant experience in business analysis area.
  • Prior business analysis experience of working between technology and business users to specify business requirements for development of systems solutions.
  • Understanding and experience in the area of Market & Counterparty Risk, specifically FRTB, SACCR, VaR, Sensitivity Risk measures.
  • Prior experience in implementing Market & Counterparty System or innovative digital solutions within Risk Management Group is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of Artificial Intelligence and machine learning framework and has worked on data science project is an advantage.
  • Team player with strong inter-personal, communication, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficient in SQL, Excel and data visualization tools.
 Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_title: Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst, Group Research - (2994BR)
company_overview:
The National Healthcare Group (NHG) is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities. Care is provided through an integrated network of six primary care polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together they bring a rich legacy of medical expertise to our philosophy of integrated patient-centred care.
NHG's vision is "Adding Years of Healthy Life". This vision goes beyond merely healing the sick to the more difficult and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life. With some 20,000 staff, NHG aims to provide care that is patient-centric, accessible, seamless, comprehensive, appropriate and cost-effective.
As the Regional Health System (RHS) for Central Singapore, it is vital for NHG to partner and collaborate with stakeholders, community advisors, and voluntary welfare organisations. Together with our patients, their families and caregivers, we aim to deliver integrated healthcare services and programmes that help in Adding Years of Healthy Life to all concerned.
job_description:
You will have the opportunity to be a key member of an interdisciplinary research team (HOMER, which stands for Health Outcomes and Medical Education Research) to examine issues related to population health and health professions education. You will work closely with healthcare professionals and administrators to conceptualise and conduct rigorous research studies that can improve the healthcare sector and the health of the population.

Responsibilities 

  • Design and conduct research studies to address population health and education needs
  • Evaluate and implement population health and health professions education research
  • Pre-process, analyse, and interpret data to make recommendations so as to improve the healthcare sector and the health of the population
  • Manage research projects with stakeholders from various disciplines/ institutions
  • Conduct research workshops
  • Communicate findings to academic and practitioner communities
  • Improve the efficacy of health professions education activities in NHG and the surrounding systems supporting those activities
Requirements
  • A postgraduate degree in population health sciences, epidemiology, health economics, anthropology, communications, education, human computer interaction, human factors, organizational behaviour, psychology, social work, sociology, knowledge management, statistics, data analytics, business analytics, or other related disciplines.
  • Candidates without postgraduate qualifications but with strong research skills/ experience will also be considered
  • Proficient in data analysis, machine learning, and the use of at least one software such as R, STATA, Python
  • Proficient in sampling methods and survey designs
  • Experience in GIS and relevant work experience  in healthcare settings and population health will be an added advantage
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills, able to articulate thoughts readily
  • Passionate about quantitative and/or experimental research
Please elaborate in your CV on your quantitative skills/experience (e.g., familiarity with which analytical techniques and corresponding software).
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company: APBA TG Human Resource Pte Ltd
company_overview:

job_description:
On behalf of our Client who is a leading manufacturer of fragrance and flavours, we are sourcing for a Master Data Management (MDM) Responsible in SAP PP module.
The MDM Responsible manages master data management related activities within PP of the Global SAP (GSAP) project organization and towards the affiliates in scope of the GSAP implementation.
Primarily objectives for the position include:
  • Explain link between GSAP processes and MD objects and fields to affiliates
  • Request affiliates to prepare and clean master data in current ERP system
  • Help affiliates to work on rules for data extraction and transfer the current MD towards GSAP requirements. Remark: Extraction will be done by local IT
  • Prepare and support affiliates for data migration and check the results
Job Responsibilities:
  • Understands company’s business processes and how they are defined in GSAP
    • Makes sure SAP organizational structure  is defined accordingly
    • Identifies MD objects and fields
  • Defines content and rules for MD fields
    • Content: e.g. free text, predefined values in SAP customizing, Yes or No values
    • Rules: When, why and how to fill which data into a MD fields
  • Work on standardizing the data, which includes
    • Collecting actual data from affiliates
    • Organizing discussion and consensus on an harmonized data set
  • Make sure responsibility and accountability (RACI matrix) are defined for each MD field
  • Clarifies if MD fields are defined and used globally or locally
  • Makes sure that MD fields are used according to SAP standard
  • Supports Migration tasks, including data transformation and data cleansing
Job Requirements:
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Information Technologies
  • Experience in Master Data Management in SAP modules
  • IT Background and experience in Data Mining, Data Analysis, Data Structures
  • Knowledge and experience in understanding business requirements in the Production
  • Understand Global SAP processes and link to MD objects and fields
  • Global coordination of MDM related topics within PP Stream and with affiliates
  • Analytical skills
  • ERP / SAP skills
  • MUST BE ABLE to travel overseas extensively for business trips
Additional Job Information:
  • Permanent position
  • This position is only open to consider job seekers who DOES NOT need Work Passes to work in Singapore. 
Visit GMP Job Portal at www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 20112 for more job details.
If you are keen in this role, you may also send us your updated CV in MS Words format to Christopher Wong (R1104673) at christopher.wong@gmprecruit.com for review and we will arrange for a convenient time to speak more.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company_overview:
The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) has evolved over the past 20 years to become one of the leading regional centres for cancer treatment and research. It has pioneered the one-stop multi-disciplinary approach to cancer treatment and is now home to oncologists, surgeons and researchers, dedicated to the care and treatment of a growing number of cancer patients.

Today, NCCS see close to 65 per cent of the public sector oncology cases in Singapore. To deliver the latest cancer care and treatment, clinicians work closely with researchers who conduct robust cutting-edge clinical and translational research which has received international recognition.

NCCS strives to be a global leading cancer centre, and shares its expertise and knowledge by training the next generation of medical professionals.
job_description:
The Clinical Data Scientist role is responsible for driving and maintaining regional genomic data collection and storage, for research projects initiated by National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS). This role will work closely with stakeholders from various specialties in NCCS, as well as external parties such as research centres and genomic platform service providers.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Lead communications with genomic platform service provider on new initiative to manage genomic data records
  • Liaise with relevant functions to address issues involving data governance policies
  • Maintain genomic data records systematically
  • Manage operations of genomic platform
  • Support users with queries on the genomic platform
  • Evaluate process and platform performance, and work on areas of improvement

Requirements:

  • At least BSc in a relevant field (eg. bioinformatics)
  • At least 1 year of work experience in data science/ clinical genomic data
  • Technical experience in at least 1 of the following areas is an advantage: computational genomic workflows (e.g. GATK), relational databases, Linux/cluster environments, Docker, Cloud compute (e.g. AWS) and/or other data science systems. 
  • Good planning skills with ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders concurrently
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Fluent in both written and spoken English

job_title: Vice President, Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst
company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities

Job Responsibilities

Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst is a specialist role within UOB's Group Security Operations Center. The incumbent will be responsible for running the cyber threat intelligence operations and enhancing the existing threat research processes. He/She must have good knowledge relating to the current cyber threat landscape and have past working experience in investigating and analysing cyber security incidents and providing assessments to enhance the detection, prevention, response and monitoring capabilities for the Bank's security operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Participate in the intelligence cycle and manage information provided by various intelligence sources
  • Perform analysis on campaigns, threat actor TTPs (Tactics, Techniques and Procedures), technical indicators of compromise, cyber-attack trend, and exploitation of technology and prepare threat assessments on new developments, threats or vulnerabilities
  • Work with internal and external partners to manage the ingestion, aggregation and sharing cyber threat intelligence internally and externally
  • Research on advanced threat actors' TTPs and capabilities to provide adversarial intelligence to support threat hunters
  • Proactively identify threat trends and provide insights to improve overall Cybersecurity risk posture
  • Support any cyber incident response and investigation
  • Participate in industry threat intelligence forums to maintain up-to-date security industry awareness and attack trends
Job Requirements

Job Requirements

Education

  • Diploma/Degree in Cyber Security/Information Technology/Engineering from recognised academic institutions
  • Professional Cyber Security related qualifications (E.g. GCTI, GOSI, GCIH, GCFA, GNFA, etc.) is preferred

Technical Skills and Experience

  • Minimum 5-6 years of relevant experience with at least 2-3 years of Security Operations experience
  • Advanced understanding of Cyber Security concepts and how Cyber Operations are conducted
  • Advanced understanding on the MITRE ATT&CK Framework and related frameworks
  • Advanced understanding on adversarial mindset and motivations
  • Advanced understanding on the use of threat modeling tools like STRIDE, DREAD and analytical tools like Diamond Model
  • Good understanding of endpoint and network architecture
  • Good understanding of modern web, cloud and container technologies
  • Experienced with using commercial and OSINT threat information tools
  • Experienced with the use of SIEM and TIP

Soft Skills

  • Excellent writing and presentation skills
  • Ability to succinctly and accurately convey verbalization of thoughts and ideas
  • Ability to tailor products suitable for different consumers
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to adhere to work processes and procedures

Other Requirements

  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to work well with the rest of the team and department
     
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

company_overview:
Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.
Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.
Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee. 
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace
Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.
In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.
job_description:
Carro is seeking for a Corporate Development Management Associate to join the team in supporting strategy and corporate development execution. The role covers mainly market research, data (quantitative such as financial data and qualitative) analysis, trend identification, presentation of insights and recommendation to management. In addition to that, it covers basis dashboard presentation, processes review and improvement and project management 

As it is both an internal and external facing role, candidates must have a dynamic, engaging, and pragmatic personality, with sufficient ambition to learn and take ownership.

Whilst experience in related internship is not a prerequisite, candidates must be open to new ideas and ways of working, able to understand and interpret complex challenges and contribute ideas.

What you will be doing:

·        Strategy

o  Provides and delivers strategic data analysis, insights such as identifying, cultivating, and analysing qualitative and quantitative (internal and external) data

o  Contributes to improving systems, processes, and tools particularly as they enhance the vision of data analytics, innovation, social impact investing and/or strategy development

o  Support in presentations preparation to management

·        Corporate Development

o  Conduct research and analyses industries, market segments, and business models.

o  Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets

o  Prepare recommendation and evaluates the merits of alternatives and presents findings to management

o  Assist in evaluating of potential corporate development opportunities such as high-level financial analysis, due diligence

o  Monitor existing strategic initiatives and prepare reporting

o  Assists with project management and coordination/development of work plans, deliverables, and activities.

o  Monitor performance of on-going strategic initiatives

o  Maintains report forms, formats, information dashboards, data generators, reports and other resources.

What you will need

o  Bachelor’s degree with a preference on management, finance, economics, statistics

o  Other qualification such as financial modelling, Merger and Acquisition courses would be an added advantage

o   1 to 2 years experience with consulting firm/ Big 4 in strategy, consultancy, Merger and Acquisition, deal/risk advisory is a plus

o  Internship experience with consulting firm and audit firm is a plus

o  Strong research skills, good written and verbal communication, and the willingness to work as part of the team

o  Demonstrated experience in quantitative and qualitative data research and analysis.

o  Abilities to speak other languages is a plus

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Job Description

Business Analyst (Payments), Future Ready Technology, Technology & Operations  - (210000A4)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble, and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage many of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
What we are looking for as a Business Analyst:
Business Analysts helps business do business better. You are an agent of change. As business analysts, you identify and define the solutions that will maximize the value delivered by an organization to its stakeholders. You will also work across all levels of an organization and may be involved in everything from defining strategy, to creating the enterprise architecture, to taking a leadership role by defining the goals and requirements for programs and projects or supporting continuous improvement in its technology
Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with business users and vendors/partners for solution planning and integration
  • Manage cross functional/matrix business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business processes, establishing project scope, goals and key value creation
  • Work closely with business stakeholders and system development team to gather requirements, Functional Specification Developments
  • Facilitate conflict resolution and able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective
  • Work with respective stakeholders on UAT planning, execution, identifying project risk and critical paths
  • Provide project dashboard reporting and metrics to business sponsor and key stakeholders
  • Coordinate with country business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases
  • Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues
  • Owns and manages process repository and is responsible for maintenance of all processes in the domain/sub-domain – (Payment utilities)
Requirements:
  • Analytical and with drive to solve problems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and good presentation skills
  • The ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, subject matter experts, developers
  • Pro-active and able to organize, coordinate, and direct users and teams
  • Familiar with project management and SDLC process and writing Business Requirement Document & Functional Specification
  • Process positive attitudes and able to adopt to changes fast
  • Working experience in Banking environments will be an advantage
  • Having mobile applications and payments knowledge will be an advantage
  • Delivery focused and results oriented
  • Attention to details and highly organized and able to work under pressure in a time-critical environment
  • Ability to work independently, and keep calm when under stress
  • Microsoft Excel/Powerpoint/Projects/Word/Visio
  • Good Understanding of Payment/External Partnership Integration will be a plus
  • High level understanding of technologies associated with API
  • Understanding and hands-on experience in both Agile and Waterfall approaches in SDLC
  • Familiar with Jira and Confluence tools will be an advantage
  • Excellent organizational, vendor and partner management, negotiation, and prioritization skills
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

company_overview: Avensys is a leader in providing technology enabled business solutions and services. Since inception, Avensys has helped clients use IT more efficiently to improve their operations and profitability, focus on core competencies and achieve business results such as increased agility, innovation and profitable growth. Our in-depth technical knowledge coupled with industry experience and our unique methodologies enable us to successfully deliver and meet our customer’s expectations.
job_description:
Job Description
Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success, we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail and supply chain.
We are currently looking to hire Data Engineer who has proven track record in IT Industry. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.
Data Engineer
Responsibilities:
• Design & Architecture: You help to design and implement an optimal data pipeline architecture for the client’s analytics system.
• Identify, design, and implement improvements to automate manual processes, optimize speed and efficiency of data delivery, architecting and designing for high availability, scaling, and reliability.
• Architect and design infrastructure to facilitate data extraction, transformation, export, and query of data from a variety of data sources, both internal and external, both small and large.
Massive data: You will source / examine, analyze, engineer data pipelines for gigabytes/terabytes of structured and unstructured data with our platform to create value for customers. You will also be working with Enterprise data.
Requirements:
• Bachelor's / Master's in Information Technology / Computer Science, or related degree AND you have a strong ethos of continuous learning.
• You have 11+ years of professional software development experience in multiple programming languages, including modern virtual-machine languages such as Java, as well as common scripting and glue languages such as Python and version control (git), with good analytical & debugging skills.
• Experience performing root-cause analysis on bugs and performance problems in distributed systems, including network and source-level debugging.
• Big data: You have extensive experience with data analytics and working knowledge of big data infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Big Query, Data Flow, Hadoop Eco System, HDFS, Apache Storm, Apache Spark. You've routinely built data pipelines with gigabytes/terabytes of data and understand the challenges of manipulating such large datasets.
• Cloud Exposure: Strong experience implementing systems and applications using distributed and cloud infrastructure. GCP preferred, but AWS or Azure are also okay.
• Data Modeling: Flair for data, schema, data model, PL/SQL, Star & snowflake schema, how to bring efficiency in data modeling for efficient querying data for analysis, understands criticality TDD and develops data validation techniques. Working knowledge of distributed relational and tabular data stores, message queues, stream processing facilities, and other scalable big-data platform technologies.
WHAT’S ON OFFER:
You will be remunerated with an excellent base salary and entitled to attractive company benefits. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to enjoy a fun and collaborative work environment, alongside a strong career progression
To submit your application, please apply online or email your UPDATED CV in Microsoft Word format to seema@aven-sys.com Your interest will be treated with strict confidentiality.

CONSULTANT DETAILS:
Consultant Name : Seema Verma
Avensys Consulting Pte Ltd
EA Licence 12C5759

Privacy Statement: Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with the relevant data protection law and Avensys' privacy policy.

job_title: MES Project Manager & Analytics Data Scientist (Senior Staff Engineer)
company_overview:
About ams and OSRAM

The ams Group, including the listed companies ams AG as the parent company and OSRAM Licht AG, is a global leader in optical solutions. By adding intelligence to light and passion to innovation, we enrich peoples’ lives. This is what we mean by Sensing is Life. Our around 30,000 employees worldwide focus on innovation across sensing, illumination and visualization to make journeys safer, medical diagnoses more accurate and daily moments in communication a richer experience.

To find out more about us on https://ams-osram.com
job_description:
This job call for both IT/MES and Project Management skill. The role is to gather user requirement, analyze and transform it into MES model, and closely work with various IT team on the deliverable, meeting Cost, Time and Quality (CTQ). This role also call for data analytic skill to improve the digital maturity of current system to the next level, like traceability, yield improvement, performance improvement.

Job Responsibilities

  • Project Management for Factory MES related projects on both new and existing product
  • Develop project estimates, plans and approaches to manage end-to end project execution
  • Collaborate with Maintenance, Process, Product and Production Team to identify their needs
  • Analyze and transform requirement (user perspective) into MES model (IT perspective) as well as developing/maintaining an overall project plan
  • Partnership with IT to ensure MES System is delivered accordingly, meeting cost, time and quality
  • Analysis of sophisticated product flow, so as to enable unit traceability, process correlation yield analysis, performance management, seamless integration of various UI for easy drill-down analysis
  • Conduct Project Review with Stakeholder for project update

Job Requirement

  • Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
  • Advantage for candidate holding industry certification that is IT or Project Management related
  • Example: Oracle DB related Certification, Microsoft related Certification, PMP
  • Min 10 years’ experience in IT field of Manufacturing Environment
  • Min 3 years’ experience in Project Management
  • Experience with the following will be added advantage
  • Factory MES (Promis, Consilium, Camstar)
  • Full system development from zero ground, covering setup (Server, Storage, VM, OS, DB, web engine), design (how information is collected, stored, transformed, presentation), development (C#, Python, PLSQL, JSP), deployment and maintenance
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to break down and solve complex problems in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
  • Confident to take a project from requirements gathering through to launch and into production
  • Ability to work independently with attention to details and deadlines, is enthusiastic, self-motivated with positive attitude and team-oriented
  • Ability to take on multiple tasks of engaging stakeholders at all levels with excellent communications skills, both written and oral
  • Ability to organize and lead meetings to drive improvement actions
job_requirement_qualification: Not Specified

job_title: SO/MGR, Platforms and Market Data Management, UOB Asset Management
company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
UOB Asset Management is a leading Asian asset manager with award-winning investment expertise in fixed income and equities. Headquartered in Singapore, we offer global investment management expertise to individuals, institutions and corporations from a regional network spanning Thailand, Malaysia, Brunei, Japan and beyond. Our comprehensive product suite includes innovative solutions covering retail unit trusts, exchange-traded funds and customised portfolio management services.
Job Responsibilities
You will be responsible for providing platforms and market data support to business unit across the organization for both Singapore and regional office. You will act as the regional system administrator to support the day-to-day operations for order management system (Bloomberg Asset & Investment Manager 'AIM') and user access administration for all other platforms. You will also manage the vendor management which involves regular liaison with vendors and business users. 
Regional System Administrator
-    Support the day-to-day operations for order management system (Bloomberg AIM) in terms of user/account maintenance, static data maintenance, user queries for both Singapore and regional office. 
-    Perform user access administration request (create, remove, unlock/lock, assign roles and etc) for all platforms used in Singapore Office
-    Liaise with vendors and/or internal IT on issues, new enhancements, change request or system configurations 
-    Maintain issue log and conduct periodic review with vendors to escalate high priority issues 
-    Perform regular user access reviews, static data reviews and assist in audit reviews
-    Develop, document, and implement procedure manual to enforce system administration related policies and standards
Vendor Management
-    Manage vendor contracts related to platforms and market data subscriptions 
-    Assist with new platform/market data subscription, termination, and contract renewal process 
-    Assist business unit with market data assessment prior to subscription and termination
-    Liaise with vendors for quotation, invoice queries and any other general requests from business units 
-    Liaise with vendor and various business units to review and execute agreements 
-    Work closely with Finance Team to review invoices and follow up with vendors for any discrepancies 
-    Consolidate and maintain the vendor inventory list to provide reporting on platforms and market data spend by region/business unit
Job Requirements
  • Degree in Computer Science/ Finance (or equivalent)
  • Minimum of 5 years of work experience in financial industry, preferably asset management
  • Experience in user access administration
  • Experience in market data vendor and contract management
  • Experience with platforms such as Bloomberg AIM and FactSet will be an advantage
  • Able to work well under pressure and a good team player
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, negotiation skills and organization skills
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.
