company_overview:
Society currently faces a number of daunting challenges. The world’s population is growing rapidly, more and more megacities are forming and demand for energy continues to spiral across the globe. In addition, the rising need for climate protection calls for new approaches to energy consumption in many areas of everyday life.
Infineon Technologies AG offers semiconductor and system solutions addressing three central challenges to modern society: energy efficiency, mobility, and security. In the 2014 fiscal year (ending September 30), the company reported revenues of 4.32 billion euros with approximately 29,800 employees worldwide. In January 2015, Infineon acquired US-based International Rectifier Corporation, a leading provider of power management technology, with revenues of USD 1.1 billion (fiscal year 2014 ending June 29) and approximately 4,200 employees.
job_description:
Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.
We make life easier, safer and greener - with technology that achieves more, consumes less and is accessible to everyone. Microelectronics from Infineon is the key to a better future. Efficient use of energy, environmentally-friendly mobility and security in a connected world - we solve some of the most critical challenges that our society faces while taking a conscientious approach to the use of natural resources.

In accordance with the requirements set by the Singaporean Government, Infineon Technologies Asia Pacific Pte Ltd ("Infineon") can only allow individuals who are (a) fully vaccinated, (b) certified to be medically ineligible for a vaccine or (c) have recovered from COVID-19 within a prescribed period, onto company premises. Therefore, Infineon requires all new employees, as well as contractors and business partners, to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. "Fully vaccinated" means individuals have completed the full regime of an approved COVID-19 Vaccine as listed under the World Health Organization (WHO) Emergency Use Listing (EUL) including the respective post-vaccination period to ensure the vaccine has become full effective. Anyone who is unable to be vaccinated due to an approved and/or recognised exemption condition may apply for special consideration.
In your new role you will:
  • Set up master data in Infineon's logistics systems for use in production, business units and order processing
  • Be the process owner for master data processes
  • Provide consultation to business unit users for new supply chain and business requirements
  • Support team ramp-up, provide product support and prepare product master data
  • Execute data management maintenance, error correction and archive obsolete data
  • Collaborate with IT department to implement work processes in optimizing work efficiency
You are best equipped for this task if you have:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration / Economics, Electronic / Electrical Engineering with 1-3 year experience of supply chain processes / manufacturing execution system (MES) / data management in Semiconductor industries
  • Strong analytical skill, in terms of data, system and process management
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to be the ideal team player in a multinational environment
  • Work independently and possess a structured, hands-on approach towards work
  • Experience in project management
  • Entry level candidates with relevant internship experience and able to commit to a 12-month contract period are welcome to apply
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_title: FVP, Product & Business Management, Group Commercial Banking
company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Wholesale Bank function operates a dynamic business model that provides financial services and solutions to help our clients achieve their strategic business objectives. Our mission is to become the premier-provider of banking services and solutions for Asia-based commercial banking companies (small medium enterprises), large corporations, financial institutions as well as multinational corporations. Our cover teams work in full alignment with specialised teams across Transaction Banking, Investment Banking, Global Markets and Group Retail to deliver seamless solutions to our clients.
Job Responsibilities
As part of the Data Analytics team within the division of Product Business Manment under Group Commercial Banking, you will support manrial decision-making and strategic business development through data discovery, analytics and generation of actionable insights.   Your responsibilities will include:  
  • Preparation and provision of information reports for periodic and ad-hoc portfolio performance monitoring and regulatory reporting
  • Work closely with stakehers on data extraction, provisioning and discovery initiatives
  • Cross-functional collaboration with wider analytics team and business partners to generate actionable insights to drive business objectives and continuous improvement
  • Supporting Group Commercial Banking's regional strategic projects and initiatives with data research and analytics
  • Supporting Commercial Banking and Group Wholesale Banking and/or Bank-wide projects including system rollouts / enhancements and manment dashboards.
Job Requirements
  • Recognized university with at least 4 ' prior experience in Banking and Data Analytics
  • Advanced Excel PowerPoint skills are a requirement.
  • Hands-on experience with data analysis tools like SAP BO, Qlik and PowerBI.
  • Excellent storytelling skills with the ability to articulate insights to the target audience using presentations / visualizations
  • Proficiency in VBA, SQL and Python is a plus
  • Detail-oriented, meticulous and able to operate independently
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakehers of all levels
  • Able to work under pressure and multi-task
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

company_overview:
Yishun Health is a network of medical institutions and health facilities in the north of Singapore, under the National Healthcare Group. It comprises Admiralty Medical Centre, Khoo Teck Puat Hospital and Yishun Community Hospital. It also includes community extensions such as Wellness Kampung.
With innovation in our corporate DNA and an international award winning Global Workplace Healthcare programme for our staff, there are many valued opportunities for you to grow with us. Take up one of these roles to redefine care with us, the Yishun Health way!
Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH), a 795-bed general and acute care hospital, opened in June 2010. Serving more than 550,000 people living in the northern sector of Singapore, KTPH combines medical expertise with high standards of personalised care, set within a healing environment, to provide care that is good enough for our own loved ones.
From intuitive wayfinding to logical clustering of services, KTPH's design is focused on providing a comfortable and hassle-free experience for patients. The building has garnered numerous awards for its green and energy efficient design, with wards that have views of greenery and naturally cool air. KTPH also provides a wide range of outpatient specialist services.
KTPH is part of Yishun Health, a network of medical institutions and health facilities under the National Healthcare Group in the north of Singapore, which also includes Admiralty Medical Centre, Yishun Community Hospital and extensions such as Wellness Kampung.
Vision
Adding years of healthy life.
Mission

Provide good quality, affordable and hassle-free healthcare with science, love and wisdom.
Our Care Philosophy
Care that is good enough for our own mothers without making special arrangements.
job_description:
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1.Clinical Competencies and Duties
In Speech Therapy services, the Speech Therapist must have the general clinical competences below (though not
exclusive to this list) and had attained the specific area of competency for their specialty area. Depending on current

company_overview: Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors while restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers.
job_description:
The Data Protection Executive is responsible for establishing and sustaining the data protection system in Raffles Hotel Singapore.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Acts as the primary point of contact within the organisation for colleagues, regulators and any relevant bodies on issues related to data protection.
  • Ensures organisation’s policy is in accordance with Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) and codes of practice.
  • Evaluates the existing data protection framework and identifies areas of non or partial compliance, and rectifies any issues.
  • Devises training plans, provides data protection advice and supports colleagues.
  • Informs and advises the Data Controller or Data Processor on all matters related to data protection.
  • Promotes a culture of data protection compliance across all units of the organisation.
  • Provides expert advice and educates colleagues on important data compliance requirements.
  • Drafts new and amends existing internal data protection policies, guidelines and procedures, in consultation with key stakeholders.
  • Conducts training with colleagues across different business units who are involved in data handling or processing.
  • Proactively conducts audits to ensure compliance and addresses potential issues.
  • Maintains record of all data processing activities carried out by the organisation.
  • Serves as the point of contact between the organisation and the data protection authorities.

Candidate Profile

Knowledge and Skills

  • Bachelor’s university degree or equivalent.
  • Experience working in data protection compliance or a related field, and within a legal, audit and/or risk function department preferred.
  • Knowledge in Singapore data protection laws and practices including an in-depth understanding of the PDPA.
  • Good knowledge of IT software such as Microsoft Office Suite, systems and network will be an advantage.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Oral and written fluency in English, and ability to speak other languages will be an advantage.

Competencies

  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels of colleagues.
  • Ability to work independently and has good initiative under dynamic environment.
  • Ability to work effectively and contribute in a team.
  • Service oriented with an eye for details and has an inquisitive mind.
  • Ability to manage sensitive and confidential information.
  • Flexible and able to embrace and respond to change effectively.
  • Self-motivated, energetic and work well under pressure.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
job_description:
How Will You Make an Impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
Key Job Activities
  • Organize daily inbound/outbound shipping schedule for area of responsibility.
  • Prepare necessary shipping documents.
  • Co-ordinate with forwarders and other service providers to ensure deliveries meet customer/business requirements.
  • Review open delivery orders daily and work with Operations Team to ensure packing can be completed on time for shipment.
  • Reviews all required shipping documents and communicate details to appropriate internal/external parties or customers when shipment has been executed.
  • Coordinate international/domestic orders and schedule appropriate shipments with transport service providers, determining the appropriate mode of shipment, that is consolidated or express or other best routing, and ensuring that POD is obtained for each shipment.
  • Resolve issues with internal parties to ensure shipments meet Customer/Operational expectations
  • Support in the investigation of internal/external customer complaints to find the root causes and advise appropriate solution to resolve them.
  • Act as a supporting role to work with PPI project teams in ensuring the success of implementing new project(s) assigned.
  • Supports group supervisor to collect data (if required) for them to perform the analysis and reporting work as requested by Logistics Leadership.
  • Ensure that systems and procedures within the department are in compliance with ISO9001, ISO13485, QSR21CFR, ISO14001, OHSAS18001 and WHO Good Distribution Practice.
How will you get here?
Education
  • Diploma or Degree in International Trade, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business, Finance plus three (3) years’ experience.
  • Familiar with SAP/R3 and Oracle E1 Applications.
  • Understanding of supply chain flows.
  • Logistics and customer service experience with global multi-national company.
Experience
  • Five (5) years of progressive responsible in International Trade or Import/Export Management in a multi-national company; preferably in a FMCG or capital equipment industry. Warehousing/Customer Service experience is a plus.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
  • Demonstrate Thermo Fisher Scientific values – Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement.
  • Must have thorough knowledge of international trade and transportation.
  • A Warehouse/Customer Service operation background is desirable.
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills in English, including the ability to make effective business presentations. Communicates openly and honestly.
  • Comprehensive understanding of logistics cost models, and typical routings, time, and cost for bi-directional movement of products and goods between the USA, Asia and Europe.
  • Must be able to work independently on multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously, acting in a decisive manner with a demonstrated bias for action.
  • Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to develop complex logistics and transportation models.
  • Familiarity with major logistics service provider operations.
  • Proficiency in MS Office applications (Office, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and experience with ERP systems (SAP/Oracle experience is preferred).
  • Demonstrated “Customer Centric Attitude”.
job_requirement_qualification: Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_title: AVP / Senior Assoc, Market & Counter-party Risk Business Analyst,  - (WD23713)
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function
Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure.
Responsibilities
  • Undertake the business analyst role for Market & Counterparty Risk Domain.
  • Gather, collate and analyse user' requirements from business and risk users including data science related requests and provide clear business specifications for implementations to Market & Counterparty Risk Systems.
  • Analyse and perform impact analysis of requests and review system and functional designs are sound and adequate to address Market & Counterparty Risk Business needs.
  • Devise comprehensive test plans (including test scenarios and test cases) to test system deliverables.
  • Perform User Acceptance Testing, Regression Testing, Simulation Testing and Live verifications to ensure system deliveries meet requirements objectives.
  • Plan, schedule and adhere to enhancement timeliness to meet agreed deliverables.
  • Work with digital team comprising of data scientists and data engineer to drive and experiment various digital initiatives for risk domain.
Requirements
  • Degree in Banking, Financial Engineering, Computer Science or any other related quantitative discipline with about 5 to 8 years' relevant experience in business analysis area.
  • Prior business analysis experience of working between technology and business users to specify business requirements for development of systems solutions.
  • Understanding and experience in the area of Market & Counterparty Risk, specifically FRTB, SACCR, VaR, Sensitivity Risk measures.
  • Prior experience in implementing Market & Counterparty System or innovative digital solutions within Risk Management Group is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of Artificial Intelligence and machine learning framework and has worked on data science project is an advantage.
  • Team player with strong inter-personal, communication, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficient in SQL, Excel and data visualization tools.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview:
TTSH is one of Singapore’s largest multi-disciplinary hospitals with more than 174 years of pioneering medical care and development. The hospital has 45 clinical and allied health departments, 16 specialist centres. It also has three institutes that are spearheading care, research and innovations in geriatric medicine, infectious diseases and ophthalmology. Powered by more than 8,000 healthcare staff, TTSH sees over 2,500 patients at its specialist clinics and some 460 patients at its emergency department every day. TTSH is part of the National Healthcare Group, providing holistic and integrated patient care.  With a strong quality culture steeped in patient safety, TTSH constantly challenges itself to provide faster, better, cheaper and safer care for patients. To achieve this, the hospital keeps abreast and believes in investing in its staff, facilities, medical technology and system improvements.

More information is available at www.ttshhr.com
job_description:
JOB SUMMARY
  1. To oversee all aspects of epidemiology required for research in Tan Tock Seng Hospital, including study design, reduction of bias and confounding factors, preparation of data collection databases, power calculation, and data analysis (in collaboration with the Biostatistician),

  2.  To support TTSH clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in grant applications and manuscript publication

  3. To teach on epidemiology and statistics-related topics
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESSPECIFIC
  1. Operational
  1. Work closely with clinician and allied health Principal Investigators and biostatisticians in designing research studies and clinical trials, and data management.
    • Formulate and review research questions, study objectives, testable hypothesis, and definition of specific relevant outcome endpoints

    •  Select and review appropriate target population and eligibility criteria
  • Create case definition(s), identify time frame (recruitment and follow-up) and select design taking into account logistical and time constraints

  • Identify sources of bias and methods to minimize them

  • Identify potential confounders and strategies to minimize them

  • Identify sampling methods given the context of the situation

  • Provide sample size/power calculations and justifications
    • Generate and oversee generation of randomization codes for study allocation

    • Review data collection instruments using new or existing information systems (in collaboration with CRIO data managers where necessary)

    • Review database requirements, such as inclusion of the necessary variables and data dictionary

    • Assist in the co-ordination among all groups involved in the study

 
  1. Provides statistical analysis (using SPSS, Stata, R etc.) and results interpretation.
    • Define and review analysis plan to ensure that study objectives are met

    •  Identify and validate the choice of statistical techniques

    • Specify and validate the parameters to estimate

    • Specify and validate the assumptions to be used in interpreting results

    • Create and validate datasets for analysis

    • Conduct analysis of data, including descriptive summary statistics, univariate tests, measures of association, multivariable analysis, and longitudinal trend analysis

    • Interpret and review the interpretation of measures of association, confidence intervals, and p-values

    • Create and review reports and necessary components, including tables, graphs, and charts for presentation and publication

    • Evaluate conclusions and interpretations, assess validity and reliability of data collection instruments and methods, and any other potential limitation.

  2. Provide support for clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in grant applications;
    • Review competitive grant proposals to ensure   completeness and compliance with grant instructions, and sound research & ethics principles

    • In collaboration with team biostatisticians, assists with writing the relevant sections of grant proposals including but not limited to study protocols & biostatistical methodologies

    • Upon successful grant applications, to assist Principal Investigators in resolving problems encountered including scope change, turnaround time delays, authorship disagreements etc.)

  3. Provide support for clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in getting their research published by;
    • Suggesting appropriate journals for publication depending on manuscript focus

    • Assist in preparing manuscripts that are journal publication ready (i.e. meeting journal publication guidelines)

    • Assisting with literature search and review

    • Review selection of methods, and content for communication of study findings and assist in deciding relevance/representation of data to report and identifying inconsistencies in data/other content presented

    • Evaluates information to be included in manuscript drafts with regard to content (quality and relevance), audience (appropriate and relevant to audience needs), and context (credibility of cited sources and suitability of purpose).

    •   Assists Principal Investigators address reviewers' feedback

    • Review written summary reports for use within the institution, abstracts either for publication or for presentation at scientific meetings, and manuscripts for scientific publications

 
  1. Assists in creating slides/posters, either for communication in scientific meeting or for institutional communications, that are effective in conveying complex key messages, and appropriate for the intended audience

  2. Shares knowledge and provide training for epidemiology and statistics-related topics in courses organized by CRIO. Staff will also be encouraged to teach on writing and presentation skills. Where necessary, support for staff attending such courses will be provided.

  3. Applies principles of good ethical and scientific practice (e.g., data and safety monitoring) as they relate to study design, data collection, dissemination, and any further use of the information collected or gained

  4. To develop knowledge and expertise (through attending relevant courses) in domains where CRIO in-house expertise may be lacking. These would include mixed-method research designs, survey research methods, systematic review, meta-analysis and innovation methodologies. To assist PIs in identifying resources in and outside of organization when help is needed.
GENERAL  
  1. Assemble databases and other sources of information, such as the electronic medical literature, for analysis of health questions.

  2. Support special projects as requested by managerial, administrative or operational staff

  3. Perform any other duties as assigned by the Supervisor / Head of department including taking on administrative duties

  4. Actively participate as a member or team lead for quality improvement projects of Hospital-wide / Departmental level

  5. Constantly evaluate and make continuous improvement to the Epidemiology work processes

JOB REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION

  • Preferably a medicine or science basic degree (BSc, MBBS or MD or BSc Nursing) but other candidates (eg. With degree in Psychology) may also apply.

  • At least MSc qualification. The postgraduate degree should be in Public Health or Epidemiology.
PRE-REQUISITES
  1. Proficient in MS office applications and statistical software.

  2. Ability and have strong interest in research.

  3. Able to follow a problem to conclusion. Able to identify complex problems and retrieve information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

  4. Able to work with a variety of people and have a congenial personality.

  5. Able to speak and write effectively.

  6. Able to exercise patience, flexibility and willingness to work under a variety of conditions.
EXPERIENCE
At least one year of postgraduate experience, working in epidemiology-related fields or in public health.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_description:
User Analyst (Assistant Manager)

The incumbent shall be responsible to:

  • Support the implement of new Billing system and any system enhancement subsequently in NUHS Cluster
  • Work closely with external vendors and internal stakeholders in the development/ support of new system in the public healthcare landscape as a Subject Matter Expert. This includes analysing the end to end processes from charging, billing and claims under various patient settings (Inpatient, Day Surgery, Outpatient, Emergency, Community Hospital and Primary Care) and special scenarios.
  • Responsible for the documentation of system workflow/ set-up documentation for the various patient settings and to ensure that they are kept up to date with MOH policies and billing system design.
  • Partner with stakeholders from various sites in ensuring completeness in documentation and testing for business needs.
  • Design/ Create test scenarios with business stakeholders.
  • Perform end-to-end user acceptance testing (UAT) from charging to billing and interface to various downstream system. Test execution and verification and follow-up on UAT defects.
  • Quantify results of process change/ improvements and involve in change management process with key stakeholders.
  • Provide end user training on all new/ updated processes.

Job Requirements

  • Degree in Business / Information Technology or the equivalent or related disciplines with more than 5 years of relevant working experience.
  • Project management, change management and facilitation experience in matrixed environment.
  • Experience in business processes and system in healthcare industry will be an advantage.
  • Knowledge/expertise of Finance module in SAP FICO/ SAP IS-H
  • Pro-active, resourceful, able to take challenges, work independently or as a team.
  • Able to work in a dynamic face paced environment

job_description:
About our group:
Seagate’s Equipment Design Engineering (EDE) team develops automation solutions for factories to improve the manufacturing process capability and efficiency. Our team is also actively conducting research and technology staging in the area of Artificial Intelligence to pave the way for implementing Industry 4.0 in the Seagate factory.
About the role - you will:
  • Work with Seagate EDE team in implementing Artificial Intelligence (AI) for automated Hard Disc Drive (HDD) assembly equipment
  • Develop innovative solutions using advanced machine learning/deep learning techniques in areas such as image analytics, time-series data analytics, and reinforcement learning
About you:
  • A degree holder in Data Science, Mechanical Engineer or other related fields
  • Minimum 2 years working experience in related fields
  • Possess solid knowledge in data analytics and machine learning algorithms
  • Possess strong analytical skills to review systems and codes to identify issues or areas for improvement.
  • A successful candidate should have strong teamwork qualities as well as communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Your experience includes:
  • Experience in using Python and its data analysis and data visualization libraries (Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Matplotlib, Seaborn)
  • Experience in using machine learning frameworks: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch
Location:
Our Woodlands site is one of the largest electronics manufacturing sites in Singapore, housing our recording media operations. Spread over three sites, it is easily accessible via bus or from the MRT Station, with many employees taking mass transportation to work. Ample free on-site parking is also available. Here at work, you can enjoy breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks at our on-site canteen and coffee shop. We offer a range of facilities including an in-house gym and dance studio, as well as after-work badminton and table tennis competitions. On-site celebrations and community volunteer opportunities also abound. Don’t miss our Lunar New Year Lion Dance performance or our Seagate’s Got Talent event.

We are seeking a highly quantitative, driven, process & detail-oriented Business Planning & Sales Operations Analyst who will serve as a member of the Business Planning & Operations team with a focus on Japan & Korea. The mission of the Business Planning & Operations group is to maximize business performance by being the objective, trusted partner to the organization – through operational excellence, strategic planning and cross-functional collaboration. We also identify strategic initiatives to support revenue growth.The ideal candidate should have a proven record of quantitative analytical capabilities, coupled with experience in operational process management and project execution. There will be an expectation for the candidate to be self-starting and move fast, utilizing and adapting global tools and processes. Getting to grips with complex data and designing processes paired with an understanding of business challenges is key to success in this role. This is a contractor position located in our APAC HQ office in Singapore.Responsibilities:
  • Data-driven business analytics
    • Data Analytics and Insight into Business and Operations through a variety of tools including Tableau, SQL and high proficiency in Excel. Additionally, build and manage data dashboards that help Sales track and manage performance on big bets and performance
    • Perform impactful market analysis or opportunity sizing on major revenue trends, including vertical/sub-vertical performance, product adoption, leading revenue indicators, productivity and sales effectiveness to identify key levers for driving revenue growth
  • Operating Cadence/ Rhythm of business
    • Provide analysis for standard cadence of operations supporting Sales organisation (e.g., account transfers, revenue review, goal setting), planning and operational deliverables e.g. regular revenue reviews, quarterly/annual reviews
    • Contribute to operational excellence in the sales organization through identification and execution of opportunity areas such as data pipeline development that create efficiency, remove obstacles, or create improved processes and approaches to the business
  • Special projects and initiatives
  • E.g. funnel analysis (assess health of advertiser ecosystem across differing service levels taking into consideration historical & real-time data, graduation rates) or product adoption potential (market sizing, analyzing solution adoption and building tracker for monitoring)

Required Qualifications:
  • 3+ years’ experience in analytical role or tech, consulting, investment banking, private equity, corporate development or strategy
  • BA/BS degree in analytical subjects (Business, Finance, Statistics, CS, Mathematics, Information Systems, etc) or equivalent practical experience
  • Demonstrated problem-solving ability with experience providing practical business insights from large, complex data sets
  • Ability to extract and manipulate data using SQL & Tableau as well as build, publish and maintain custom dashboards
  • Strong project management and ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment

Preferred Qualifications
  • Familiarity with the digital advertising business
  • Previous experience in consulting or corporate strategy/planning
  • Fluency in Korean and/or Japanese language to work on Japan and/or Korean market.

job_title: IT Business Analyst supporting Tax and Treasury with commodity trading MNC
company: The CAP Consulting Group Pte Ltd
company_overview:
The CAP Consulting Group Pte Ltd (UEN.: 201417121 C) is a company registered in Singapore. It is a boutique recruitment firm specialising in mid to senior level searches for roles spanning across all industries in Singapore and parts of Asia ( China, Malaysia, Indonesia etc). The roles that the firm covers include Finance/Accounting, General Management, Corporate Affairs, HR, Supply Chain, Sales & Marketing, Risk, Business Development, Technology  etc. More info on the co can be found at its website is at www.cap-cg.com.
CAP Consulting was founded by Caroline Poh, a finance search consultant/veteran with a stellar record of more than 20 years of recruitment/ search experience and success in the search industry. She has established her credibility as the “go-to finance search specialist” in successfully recruiting for mid to senior level finance roles in Singapore.
job_description:
• Min 5 to 8+ years of BA experience with experience supporting Tax and Treasury
  • Has exposure to Allegro and CXL, with understanding of the treasury function including cashflow forecasts and OTC derivatives
  • Strong business analysis skills with proven track record in the delivery of CTRM solutions
Our client is a renowned and global Commodity Trading MNC (based in town).  This is a perm role that offered attractive perks (e.g., 25 days leave, good var bonus and generous benefits).
As the IT Business Analyst in this commodity trading MNC, you are part of the global IM/ IT department and are accountable for the scoping and definition of business and system requirements in one or more line of    businesses, and working with the technical teams (on design, build, configuration & test), to ensure that these are delivered to a high quality to the relevant business teams.
You will perform the following functions:
Business Analysis
• Understand the business processes and flows to enable the analysis of business requirements and the development of solutions
• Work closely with process owners and key end-users to capture detailed, unambiguous business requirements
• Work with the other business analysts and development teams to capture system requirements and drive the design of quality technical solutions
System implementation
System configuration, security/authorization set-up, user documentation, data interface design, data migration and data reconciliation

Continuous improvement
• Assist in optimizing business performance by continually looking to improve the alignment between business processes and the CTRM in conjunction with business process owners
• Gain consensus on new process concepts to move process improvement forward
• Drive the adoption of best practice in the IM and business domains and support the use of standardized processes, systems, and solutions
Testing
• Develop and agree test scripts (steps and expected positive and negative results) with the business SME and IM teams
• Run unit and system integration tests
• Ongoing engagement with the automated testing team to provide requirements for the automation of regression testing
• Plan and run user acceptance tests
• Provide business and IM support parallel run testing
Support
• Act as the key specialist point of contact for service providers in problem solving and investigations related to incidents in the Marketing/Trading area where they relate to systems
• Provide 3rd line support including problem root cause analysis and resolution
• Ensure the knowledge underpinning application/service delivery is documented, managed, and maintained
• Manage service introduction and deployment of new business functionality, ensuring best practice by any third-party teams
• Training users on new functionality and creating supporting user manuals

Requirements
• An undergraduate qualification (Bachelor’s degree or equivalent) in the relevant IM or business discipline. Min 5 years of relevant BA exp, with some experience supporting the finance (including tax and treasury functions)
•Physical commodity trading / metals & mining domain knowledge is preferred
•Derivate trading for cleared and OTC transactions preferred
•Good grasp of physical contract capture, scheduling (logistics) and invoicing
•Proficiency in English
•Exposure to account treatments and month end processes - desirable
•Understanding of international VAT/GST taxation - desirable
•Back office and ERP (SAP) integration - desirable
•Functional knowledge of CTRM solutions (specific Aspect and Veson systems knowledge – desirable)
Ability to:
• Engage effectively with key stakeholders to understand business requirements / challenges
• Translate business requirements into functional design & requirements for build by technical team
• (Learn where required), configure, test & implement CTRM/ERP solutions
• Analyze issues, identify root cause(s), quantify business impacts, and implement effectual resolutions
• Recommend and implement solutions in aid of business process enhancements, usability, and operational effectiveness
Possess:
• Strong business analysis skills.
• Proven track record in the delivery of CTRM solutions
IT-savvy candidates without IM-related experience but with relevant industry background may be considered.
To apply, please send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com. Please also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv.
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
Overview:
The Data Architect is responsible for the development, optimization, and oversee client’s conceptual and logical data systems. Your duties may include preparing architect reports, monitoring the system, and supervising system migrations.
The incumbent will lead a team comprising data engineers with different technological and domain skillsets to ensure effective and efficient development, implementation and ongoing operations and maintenance of projects to meet contractual requirements. This includes effective management of stakeholders, internal project team, subcontractors/ vendors, time, budget, schedule and risks to deliver on our commitments to our customers.  For development projects, the data architect is expected to have knowledge of the SDLC methodology required to lead the development implementation. In addition, the incumbent is expected to work with other functional groups such as finance, legal, PMO and procurement.
Responsibilities: 
  • Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data.
  • Examine and identify database structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming.
  • Assess database implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.
  • Install and organize information systems to guarantee company functionality.
  • Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams.
  • Oversee the migration of data from legacy systems to new solutions.
  • Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.
  • Recommend solutions to improve new and existing database systems.
  • Educate staff members through training and individual support.
  • Offer support by responding to system problems in a timely manner.
Requirements: 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Computer / Telecommunication), Computer Science / Information Technology or equivalent
  • At least 5 years of experience in a similar role.
  • Experience in Azure SQL DB, Data factory, Synapse and data storage.
  • Experience in Azure Analytics and Power BI is highly preferred but not mandatory
  • Strong Knowledge of database structure systems and data mining.
  • Outstanding problem solver and solution provider.
  • Thirsty for knowledge and keen to explore new technologies.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of AWS/Azure or Google Cloud environment.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD and DevOps/DevSecOps
  • Customer oriented and a team player with the ability to effectively lead and motivate team member towards common objectives
  • A self-starter and ability to work under pressure and tight schedule with positive and proactive attitude to anticipate challenges and resolves issues
  • Strong competency and experience in managing and motivating multi-disciplinary teams
  • Effective communications and presentation skills, both written and oral

job_title: VP, Data Scientist, Data Management Office
company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Data Manment Office and Big Data Analytics function answers the demand for quality and credible data across the Group.
The Data Manment Office (DMO) is a business function that covers Enterprise Data Governance, Data Manment, Big Data Analytics and Enterprise Data Strategy. Data Manment Office ensures that UOB meets all data governance standards set by data regulators and optimize data manment and us to help UOB make smarter, faster and more accurate decisions and to improve operational efficiency.
The Big Data Analytics Centre (BDAC) leads the transformational build, use, and deployment of the banks next generation analytics capabilities across the organization. This exciting role will play a pivotal part as an Analytics Centre of Excellence that will take analytics to the next level through use of latest data and analytics technology currently being deployed. You will work either individually or in project teams as a subject matter expert to deliver new Big Data and Machine Learning solutions for our business partners.
Job Responsibilities
  • Design analytical solutions/experiments to solve various strategic business problems through engment and research.
  • Building and deploying Machine Learning Algorithms, Advanced Analytics, and Data Visualization across the UOB group and region.
  • Supporting the Enterprise Data Architecture and Governance Program in developing and transforming the Analytics Capabilities across the group.
  • Partnering with assigned teams and/or business units to provide deep expertise and advisory on advanced data analytics needs.
  • Strong knowledge of data and analytics architecture to ensure analytics objectives are aligned to business priorities on the Data Analytics Transformation Program.
  • Driving innovation initiatives under guidance and directives from Head of Enterprise AI Data.
Job Requirements
  • Min Post in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering , Computer Science or a related field
  • Min 8 of advanced analytics working experience in banking / financial services / consulting industry
  • Possess a strong selection of skills and experience with analytical frameworks and langus such as SQL, R, SPARK, Python, Hive and other Hadoop-based langus
  • Possess a strong ability to query and use large, robust data sets across traditional Data Warehouse and Hadoop platforms.
  • An analytical mind and team player with demonstrated ability to build strong partnerships by applying quantitative techniques to solve business problems
  • A strong communicator, with clear articulation of analytical findings through presentations.
  • Experience with data visualization packs and/or tools will be a plus
  • Innovative and Agile thinking – experience with Test and Learn Frameworks desirable
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.
Apply now and make a difference.

company_overview:
SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) oversees the management of the three Community Hospitals under the SingHealth cluster - Bright Vision Hospital, and the new Sengkang Community Hospital and Outram Community Hospital coming up in 2018 and 2020 respectively.
SCH aims to deliver a seamless and integrated care path for patients requiring sub-acute, rehabilitation and palliative care. The focus is to bring value-driven outcomes for patients and set new standards of care for community hospitals. SCH is supported by the medical expertise and research capabilities of the SingHealth-Duke NUS Academic Medical Centre.
job_description:
You will be reporting to the Manager of Financial Analytics under the Strategic Finance team, and you will be required to:

  • Provide data analytics support (including development of Machine Learning models) for Bundled Payments and Population Health, and develop dashboards within the SingHealth Group.
  • Be part of the team to work on data analytics projects that are commissioned by institutions within the SingHealth Group and provide recommendations on the financial analysis done.
  • Work with other institutions on the Ministry of Health Cozy (Costing Systemization) project and be the cluster support for this system after implementation.
  • One of your focus area will be on Capitation, which includes the developmental framework for Population Health analysis, Capitation funding models and all ETL processes in the management and maintenance of Population Health databases, registries and data analytics platforms. 
  • Support other Population Health programmes, which includes Full Acute Bundle, AH-CH bundle, One Rehab pilot, Tampines Capitation pilot amongst others. 
  • Provide the necessary training to SingHealth Community Hospitals’ Finance team on financial analytics tool.
  • Assist in projects, as and when assigned.

Requirements

  • Master's Degree/ Degree in Finance/ Statistics/ Mathematics/ Computer Science/ Engineering/ Business Analytics
  • Preferably at least 5-7 years of relevant working experience
  • Strong theoretical understanding of financial/ statistical modelling, machine learning, data mining and related techniques
  • Experience with data wrangling, data preparation and building visualisation dashboards with Tableau/ Qlik Sense/ Power BI preferred
  • Experience with algorithms and coding proficiency with tools such as R/ Python/ SQL preferred
  • Good understanding of MATLAB, SPSS, STATA preferred
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
  • Team player, independent and able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment

job_description:
Job Description

Our client is a digital industry expanding rapidly in the Asia region. Demonstrating strong growth in the region, they are looking to hire a high-caliber System Analyst to join their team in Singapore.

Responsibility:

·Bridge Product Owners and Developers - Translate the high-level product vision and initiatives into tangible, detailed requirements for developers. This can be in the form of technical documentation, systems integration documentation, API specifications, data models, architecture diagrams, process flows, or functional specifications.

·Support Product Owners - Prioritise requirements by assessing and documenting their impact and costs to the business. Help the Product Owners manage the product backlog by providing input, and justifying prioritization.

·User Stories: Define detailed user stories based on business requirements. Ensure that user stories have sufficient details so that developers are able to estimate and work with them.

·Technical Documentation: Create/extend existing technical documentation to describe the infrastructure, security, functions of the system.

·Product Owner relationship: Be available for Product Owner to discuss any dependencies or backlog topic. Assist the Product Owner in defining finer details of the product

Requirements:

·Good understanding of digital banking products and processes, and retail banking, corporate banking.

·Extremely detail-oriented and strong API experience, hands-on dev exp in Java

·Ability to translate high-level requirements into detailed documentation within the organization’s context.

·Ability to envision and design end-to-end business processes while keeping an eye on the details.

·Ability to identify and clearly document dependencies. - Excellent functional / technical / documentation skills.

company_overview:
Pacific Carriers Limited (PCL) has established itself for more than 35 years as a global player in the shipping industry.
Starting out as a ship broker to the Kuok Group’s dry cargo shipping needs, Pacific Carriers Limited has grown to become a leading dry bulk operator. Other core activities include ship owning, ship management, container feeder and breakbulk operations.
A wholly owned subsidiary of Kuok (Singapore) Limited, Pacific Carriers Limited is poised to further develop its business building on its core strengths.
job_description:
This position is for Pacific Carriers Limited (PCL), a company under Kuok (Singapore) Limited.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

The Commercial Analyst is a key early career role, enabling strong candidates to get immersed in a Profit and Loss driven environment, develop core analytical skills and leverage and develop the Group’s management reporting and risk management platforms. The role feeds into other parts of the PCL and KSL business, including portfolio management, freight futures and bunker procurement.

Business Performance Monitoring

  • Maintaining a detailed position summary for respective business unit
  • Ensuring all commitments have an accurate and updated Mark to Market
  • Engaging with freight traders and charterers to ensure accurate and current P&L management
  • Tracking FFA and bunker positions in conjunction with bunker procurement and FFA execution team
  • Competitor and benchmarking analysis

Business Intelligence

  • Tracking cargo and/or vessel movements in and out of key markets to determine supply and demand balances that shape our fleet and operating portfolio.
  • Modelling optimization opportunities in the management of freight
  • Visualization of information through Business Intelligence Software (Power BI)

Research & Analysis

  • Conducting ad-hoc analysis as required by charterers, freight traders and management
  • Analyzing vessel speed, consumption and emissions performance

Requirement

  • Minimum 3 year of experience in the maritime, commodity or energy sector
  • Demonstrably commercial and results oriented
  • Proven interest in freight, commodity and energy markets
  • Strong attention to detail with a sharp intellect and clear judgment
  • An ability to handle multiple simultaneous tasks and work accurately under pressure
  • Team player with strong levels of personal integrity and a collaborative style
  • Able to generate creative, feasible and efficient solutions to solve problems
  • Bachelor’s degree in an analytical discipline, along with an excellent academic record, is essential
  • Advanced quantitative and analytical capability and comfortable with Excel
  • Clear understanding of accounting and DCF concepts

job_description:
Application Support Analyst :

Why YOU want this position

Since our founding as a groundbreaking provider of oil & gas data, we have evolved our solutions to cover oil & gas analytics, trading & risk, and business automation for customers across the energy industry. Enverus represents this growth, while bringing us closer together as one team. Enverus delivers business-critical insights to the global energy industry through a state-of-the-art SaaS platform built on industry-leading data and energy analytics. Our solutions deliver value across the entire energy value chain, empowering customers to be more agile, efficient and competitive. The range of energy industry participants we serve includes exploration and production (E&P) companies and related businesses such as oilfield services, midstream, capital markets, power generators and utilities, energy traders, and downstream commercial & industrial energy consumers.

We are currently seeking a highly driven Application Support Analyst to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in the world’s most dynamic and fastest growing sector. Enverus is the right company at the right time.

Performance Objectives

  • Build strong customer relationships, especially with key customer stakeholders.
  • Conflict resolution - defuse conflicts among stakeholders.
  • Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work tasks or the work environment; adjusting effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements, or cultures.
  • Clearly conveying information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
  • Actively participating as a member of a team to move the team toward the completion of goals.
  • Making customers and their needs a primary focus of one's actions; developing and sustaining productive customer relationships.
  • Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with the available facts, constraints, and probable consequences.
  • Consistently maintaining high levels of activity or productivity; operating with effectiveness, and determination over extended periods of time.
  • Generating innovative solutions in work situations; trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
  • Establishing courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
  • Accomplishing tasks by considering all areas involved, no matter how small; showing concern for all aspects of the job; accurately checking processes and tasks; being watchful over a period.
  • Maintaining stable performance under pressure or opposition (such as time pressure or job ambiguity); handling stress in a manner that is acceptable to others and to the organization.
  • Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.
  • Ensure all Customer enquiries are progressed or completed in an appropriate manner, within the agreed Service Level Agreement (SLA). Monitor enquiries received via all channels and provide appropriate responses via phone, email, chat to customers.
  • To focus on continuous improvement to improve and provide a WOW customer experience including consistently high levels of attention to detail.
  • Maintain and update processes, policies and procedure documentation for internal stakeholders and customers.
  • Maintain and monitor service quality tracking/reporting tools designed to identify gaps, trends, or over achievement in service standards and take prompt, proactive action to resolve issues wherever possible. Provide feedback to our Product team for future improvements.
  • Take effective ownership of customer issues; having the confidence to handle challenging/complex cases and find a resolution during a call and following the appropriate escalation steps if necessary. Liaise with internal partners to deliver against SLAs within the required timeframes. Monitor customer service provision between delivery partners and be a primary point of contact for key clients on customer service issues.
  • Take responsibility for monitoring servers to proactively find potential issues before they happen.
  • Keep track of all the Salesforce cases/Jira tickets owned by the individual and make sure to follow up with the client regularly with proper details following the SLA.
  • Proactive approach to any issues assigned.
  • Writing queries for MSSQL, ORACLE, MYSQL using various Joins as per the client’s requirement to access the data/details per their requirement.
  • Carrying out weekend tasks which are being assigned by the client such as - License upgrade, Jars deployment etc.
  • Follow proper escalation procedure without any delay.
  • Maintain a good relationship and work closely with SLS/Data teams to mitigate the issues.

Competitive Candidate Profile

  • Have excellent English communication skills – oral and written. Candidate must be able to communicate in a clear, compassionate, and professional way.
  • Have a demonstrable passion for excellent customer service including rapport building, creating the WOW experience, and taking ownership of every customer interaction.
  • High levels of attention to detail, with the ability to log data accurately, every time.
  • Be a team player with the ability to work effectively across multi-discipline teams in a global setting.
  • Have strong computer skills with a working knowledge of MS Office suite, particularly MS Excel. Fast typing skills are required.
  • Understand global CRM systems or functional knowledge of global databases.
  • Have commercial and common sense with a practical approach to problem solving (sometimes complex).
  • Have excellent organizational, multitasking, and time management skills. Proven experience of successfully delivering work tasks requiring a high level of attention to detail.
  • Experience in a customer facing/customer support role.
  • Logical and methodical troubleshooting.
  • Comfortable following established processes and procedures
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize under pressure, while maintaining high quality output and deadlines.
  • Strong presentation skills, Excellent time management skills.
  • Basic understanding of networking, infrastructure, and associated protocols.
  • Ready to work in shifts (morning, midday, night).

SunningdaleTech Ltd is a leading precision tooling, plastics injection moulding and precision assembly company providing a broad spectrum of capabilities that include product & mould designs, mould fabrications, ultra-precision high cavitations toolings, precision injection moulding with finishing processes like spray painting and laser etching, through to precision assembly of complete products.

job_description:

  • Build, Develop and extend Fiori, SAC applications using HANA Cloud Platform
  • Develop system solutions and provide solutions for various Business/Company SAC Analytics requirements
  • Develop functional/technical specification documents and design best in class technical solutions to support SAC analytical/Reporting and dashboard design to support critical business KPIs

company_overview:
Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.

Mission: Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. We are Citi, the global bank – an institution connecting millions of people across hundreds of countries and cities.
job_description:
Responsibilities

Background:
The Citi Private Bank (“CPB”) IMR project manager/data analyst will be on a global team providing oversight for the the Issue Management and Resolution (IMR) program. The IMR program is at enterprise-level, tracking persistent and material Data Quality Exceptions (DQEs) which are inaccurate, incomplete, invalid, duplicate, unavailable, or non-standard data.These exception can impede Citi's ability to report information effectively, comply with Regulatory requirements, or affect the financials or operations of the underlying business process or downstream applications. The exception can be due to a system or a process not performing to specifications or as a result of a new regulatory demand where the required implementation date was missed.
Responsibilities:
This role is to perform Data Quality Assessments (Dispositioning), Issue Management and Resolution program delivery and Trade Records Lay-out upgrade:
  • Facilitation: Ensuring Operations & Technology SMEs participate in the Data Quality Exceptions assessments
  • IMR Planning & Execution: Coordinating Operations & Technology teams to agree delivery plans to meet Chief Data Officer lifecycle stages:
    • Root Cause Analysis
    • Planning
    • Implementation
    • Production Validation
  • Monitoring: Tracking and reporting progress against plan:
    • Ensure execution meets defined Service Level Agreements
    • Early escalation of issues to avoid SLA breaches or re-targets
  • Partner with CDO & Data Governance Officer to ensure successful delivery
Skills required:
  • 5-8 years relevant experience
  • Excellent influencing, facilitation, and partnering skills
  • Demonstrated ability to independently lead project work
  • Ability to build relationships and negotiate solutions while liaising between business, operations and technology
  • Ability to work in challenging, demanding and strict regulatory timelines
  • Advanced understanding of Project management methodologies and tools
  • Strong communication skills, ability to explain objectives, issues & risks in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders
  • Self-motivated and a team player that works well with individuals and thrives in a complex, global organization.
  • Experience with working with global teams
  • Demonstrated Data Analyst skillset (intermediate to senior level experience in a Data Analysis role)
  • Ability to monitor tight deadlines or unexpected requirement changes
Skills preferred:
  • Understanding of the principles of IT security and data protection
  • Experience using agile project management tools such as Jira
  • Experience working within the information/records management discipline
  • Experience in the financial services industry with a focus on Private Banking/Wealth Management
  • Experience with data governance, master data management, quality and lineage tools e.g. Collibra, IBM MDM, Tibco EBX, Solidatus, GlobalIDs, ASG
Education:
  • Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.
