job_title: Assistant Head, (Business Analyst ), Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
***Note: This position will be offered on a 3-year contract basis.***
The Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID) is the business transformation office to drive A*STAR towards a digitally enabled and data-driven organisation. The office is responsible to define the digital vision, formulate digital strategies and develop the digital roadmap to provide guidance for our digitalization efforts. The office acts as the catalyst in driving digital transformation and is the bridge between business owners and technology supports. As the central office, DTID performs the role as the horizontal integrator to synergise and harmonise digital efforts and drive complex and cross-cutting digital initiatives for A*STAR. Beyond business-technology, the role of DTID entails the raising of digitally skilled and creative workforce to empower our workforce to harness digital technology and embrace business transformation. To support digitalization efforts, the office is also responsible to set digital/data policies and put in place governance and standards.
You will be part of the transformation team to contribute to the development of the digital transformation roadmap and designing the digital architecture to drive A*STAR towards a digital enabled and data-driven organisation. In particular, you will work closely with corporate and research service partners, streamline their business processes, develop new business logics and adopt digital technology to enhance corporate efficiency and performance. You will also have the opportunities to co-create innovation projects and programmes with stakeholders to raise the innovation quotient of A*STAR.
Job Requirements
  • 3 to 6 years of experience in strategy consulting, business process re-engineering and project management.
  • Ability to take a strategic view of the larger digital transformation roadmap and short/medium term annual workplans, and drill deep to business needs and challenges.
  • Ability to work with teams from diverse background to analyse and identify business process challenges and formulate recommendations for process change. Experience in service journey mapping / user journeys / value stream mapping is preferred.
  • Ability to conduct user research independently such as interviews, workshops, and surveys.
  • Experience in collating, analysing and synthesising information / data as well as draw insights and conclusions from feedback, process discussions and research materials.
  • Ability to translate BPR requirements to technological requirements and propose digital solutions to achieve the desired process outcomes.
  • Ability to build a business case to support the process changes and automation.
  • Ability to drive the documentation of new business processes and lead digital projects that are cross-functional. Experience in agile project methodology is preferred.
  • Ability to operate independently, demonstrate creativity and outcome driven. Able to work with ambiguity.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills. Able to work with diverse range of corporate and research service partners.
  • Strong project management experience with attention to details.
  • Certification in Lean Six Sigma, User Experience (UX), or user research is preferred.
  • Familiarity with emerging technologies like RPA, low-code platform and workflow systems is a plus.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview: Eastport is the only Singapore home grown company established since 1980 offering international ship-brokering and consultancy services in all four shipping markets. These are the Freight Market, the Sale & Purchase Market, the New Building Market and the Demolition Market. Eastport expanded regionally and became the first in its industry to have set up in China, located in Shanghai since 1995. Eastport also is the first Asian based ship-brokerage company to enter the Western market place by setting up Eastport Maritime USA LLC in Connecticut in 1998. Following that, Eastport Holland based in Spijkenisse (near Rotterdam) was established in 2000. Most recently, we have expanded our presence in the UAE with the opening of Eastport Maritime Middle East DMCC in Dubai during 2016. With more than 160 staff around the world (over 100 in Singapore) today, Eastport is the largest Asian based ship-brokerage that participates in wide variety of industries including Chemicals, Gas, Specialty Products, Vegetable Oils, Biofuels, Crude Oil & Petroleum and the Dry Bulk.
job_description:
Job Description

As an IT Business Analyst, you analyse the business requirements to provide and implement solutions in the Company’s IT application environment e.g.  Salesforce. You also manage the IT projects through coordination, testing and user training, and support users by resolving operational issues.

Critical Work Functions

·      Requirement analysis and solutioning

o  Work closely with various business lines/offices to understand business processes, define business requirements, identify gaps and make recommendations through the Business Requirement Documents (BRD).

o  Acquire and apply extensive and deep knowledge of emerging industry practices to solve business problems.

o  Document, manage and prioritize user requests for system changes.

o  Participate in designing recommended solutions and workflow in Salesforce.

o  Understand the importance of and design Salesforce solutions integrated in the IT application landscape (e.g. integrations to ERP & reporting systems).

·      Project management

o  Perform Salesforce project management including stakeholder management, project coordination and implementation.

o  Conduct testing with relevant parties to improve the design and structure of the Salesforce platform and document changes including data-modelling and entity relationship diagrams (ERD).

o  Conduct training and prepare learning materials to ensure uptake across business lines/offices.

·      Operational maintenance

o  Resolve operational issues reported by users.

o  Monitor the status of data integration with Salesforce on a daily basis.

Job Requirements

·      Diploma in IT-related discipline.

·      Salesforce Administrator certification is essential.

·      3-5 years of experience in business analysis with hands-on experience in administering Salesforce Lightning platform.

·      Experience in designing workflow, approval processes, validation rules, custom tabs, reports, dashboards, and email generation.

·      Experience in Salesforce Apex Coding, Tableau or RPA will be advantageous.

·      Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to communicate in a professional, responsive, and friendly manner.

·      Able to work independently in a fast-paced work environment.

·      Proven decision-making skills and multi-tasking abilities.

·      Meticulous and consistent in producing quality work.

company_overview: The Learning Lab is the leading education centre for preschool, primary, secondary and junior college students in Singapore. We develop and run educational programmes in English, Mathematics and the Sciences. For the past 20 years, we have helped tens of thousands of students to achieve their personal bests at major national examinations and to develop essential life skills such as critical thinking and communication. We take great pride in designing learning approaches which go beyond helping students meet their exam needs to also help them build the key knowledge, skills and dispositions to find success in school and in life. The Learning Lab now operates in Singapore from eight facilities across the East, West, Northeast and Central regions at Marine Parade Central, Century Square, Tampines Mall, Rochester Mall, Jem, Choa Chu Kang Centre, Seletar Mall and United Square.
job_description:
The Learning Lab (TLL) is a leading organization in the private education sector. We recruit talented and dynamic people with a passion for nurturing the love of learning.

We are looking for an extraordinary Marketing Analytics Lead to drive our digital transformation journey to greater heights. Reporting to the Head of Marketing and Communications, you will have a highly visible role and will have a direct impact on the company’s direction.

Your mission is to ensure The Learning Lab’s marketing campaigns are powered by data. This means deep-diving into data to unlock customer insights and devise strategies to drive marketing effectiveness and deeper customer engagement. You must be inquisitive by nature, extremely detail-oriented, and thoroughly enjoy using data to validate hypotheses and justify business decisions.

This is an excellent opportunity for you to be part of a progressive leading educational brand that has consistently delivered inspiring learning experiences and outstanding learning outcomes for students. As part of its vision to become Asia’s leading after school K12 education group, The Learning Lab continuously strives to evolve and deliver the best-in-class customer experience for our parents and students.

Job responsibilities

  • Marketing Strategy.
  • Lead Adobe Analytics implementation across web and mobile as part of TLL’s digital transformation journey.
  • Exploit effective use of Adobe Analytics and the Adobe suite of products to track effectiveness of marketing campaigns to generate insights for process and channel improvements.
  • Analyse and transform raw data from site and CRM database into meaningful, actionable insights to drive strategic direction (e.g. forecasting of marketing budgets, identify new market opportunities, deepen customer engagement etc.) and tactical campaign execution (e.g. re-allocation of budgets across channels, campaign-level efficiency, conversion rates, re-engagement activities, etc.).
  • Assist in strategic planning for efficient allocation of marketing budget and resources.
  • Map customer data strategy based on our customer journey and review effectiveness of data collection and usage.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting.
  • Develop reporting structure for performance marketing channels.
  • Create automated KPI dashboards or visualisation for analysis and reporting to drive marketing insights.
  • Work cross-functionally with IT and Finance to define and integrate data sources and, or automate data collection for attribution and performance analysis.
  • Support marketing and communication team to set up campaigns with well-defined metrics for performance tracking.
  • Manage data collection processes and ensure quality tracking across all channels.

Snapshots of our ideal candidate

  • Possesses a recognised Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Business Analytics, Marketing Analytics or Statistics with at least 2 years of experience in digital marketing analytics.
  • Expert user of Adobe Analytics; experience in other digital analytics platform such as Google Analytics is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of performance marketing channels and experienced in optimising campaigns by relevant KPIs such as CTR, CPA, etc.
  • Expert user of MS Excel/Power Pivot and data visualisation tools such as Power BI/Tableau.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Experience Cloud is a strong advantage.
  • Excellent interpersonal communication, written, and presentation skills to articulate insights to non-technical audiences effectively.
  • Comfortable with working cross-functionally within the Marketing and Communications team, as well as with other business functions.
  • Creative and analytical individual with a positive mind-set and a strong desire to learn and collaborate.
  • Resourceful and highly independent, detail oriented with excellent time-management skills.

Expect the best for the best – an attractive remuneration package.

To find out more, please visit www.thelearninglab.com.sg. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 weeks.

job_description:
Supply Chain Analyst
Singapore
 
Who We Are:
Lumileds is the leading global light engine company serving customers in automotive lighting, general illumination, and consumer market segments. Lumileds operates in over 30 countries and has approximately 7,000 employees, Lumileds is shaping the future of light with the most innovative technology in the illumination and automotive sectors, and helping our customers deliver differentiated solutions to the world. Lumileds is headquartered in San Jose, California, with operations in Singapore, Malaysia, China and the Netherlands and sales offices throughout the world.

Together with its customers, Lumileds is making the world better, safer, more beautiful—with light.

The Lumileds environment is fast-paced, cutting-edge, intelligent and fun! We are looking for exceptional talent to join our team! To learn more, visit Lumileds.com
What You Will Do:
  • Develop weekly production loading plan for FE/BE with optimal planning of tool efficiency, work with supply planning and MFG to achieve goals target set
  • Lead discussion with supply chain, IE and material planning for weekly loading priority and output maximization alignment
  • Strong ability to drive and manage escalations with cross functional teams on any production issues to develop action plan and execution to mitigate all risks to on time delivery
  • To manage and secure R&D and Engineering loading slots without affecting Production output and requirements
  • Develop equipment unplanned downtime with Equipment team to minimize impact to Production output
  • Lead die bank operational issues, support the risk assessment of EHS and ensure audit compliance to all inventory transactions
  • Drive weekly commit plan with MFG to ensure on time delivery
  • Track and report daily shipment plan and follow up daily WIP movement to ensure shipment delivery in on track
  • Publish and monitor KPI on CLIP, cycle time and actual weekly loading. To provide recovery plan if there is any missed
  • Explore and drive continuous improvement on process optimization in planning areas and automation reports
  • Demonstrate strong leadership and ability to adapt quickly to changes in fast-paced environment

What You Will Bring (REQUIRED Qualifications):
  • Relevant planning experience in manufacturing environment
  • Well versed of SAP, MES and advanced in Microsoft Excel. Knowledge and modelled data using Power BI and Tableau for data analysis
  • Basic knowledge in semiconductor process flow
  • Agile and quick to react and take action in event of any change
  • Good analytical, communication and interpersonal skills with cross functional teams
  • Good with numbers, detailed and meticulous
  • Able to lead an operations team
  • Preferably degree in Supply Chain Management or Engineering
  • 1-3 years of relevant experience

Lumileds is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

job_title: Head | ( Business Analyst), Digital Transformation, Innovaiton & Data Division
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
The Digital Transformation, Innovation & Data Division (DTID) is the business transformation office to drive A*STAR towards a digitally enabled and data-driven organisation. The office is responsible to define the digital vision, formulate digital strategies and develop the digital roadmap to provide guidance for our digitalization efforts. The office acts as the catalyst in driving digital transformation and is the bridge between business owners and technology supports. As the central office, DTID performs the role as the horizontal integrator to synergise and harmonise digital efforts and drive complex and cross-cutting digital initiatives for A*STAR. Beyond business-technology, the role of DTID entails the raising of digitally skilled and creative workforce to empower our workforce to harness digital technology and embrace business transformation. To support digitalization efforts, the office is also responsible to set digital/data policies and put in place governance and standards.

You will be part of the transformation team to contribute to the development of the digital transformation roadmap and designing the digital architecture to drive A*STAR towards a digital enabled and data-driven organisation. In particular, you will work closely with corporate and research service partners, streamline their business processes, develop new business logics and adopt digital technology to enhance corporate efficiency and performance. You will also have the opportunities to co-create innovation projects and programmes with stakeholders to raise the innovation quotient of A*STAR.
Job Requirements
  • 7 to 10 years of experience in strategy consulting, business process re-engineering and project management.
  • Ability to take a strategic view of the larger digital transformation roadmap and short/medium term annual workplans, and drill deep to business needs and challenges.
  • Ability to work with teams from diverse background to analyse and identify business process challenges and formulate recommendations for process change. Experience in service journey mapping / user journeys / value stream mapping is preferred.
  • Ability to conduct user research independently such as interviews, workshops, and surveys.
  • Experience in collating, analysing and synthesising information / data as well as draw insights and conclusions from feedback, process discussions and research materials.
  • Ability to translate BPR requirements to technological requirements and propose digital solutions to achieve the desired process outcomes.
  • Ability to build a business case to support the process changes and automation.
  • Ability to drive the documentation of new business processes and lead digital projects that are cross-functional. Experience in agile project methodology is preferred.
  • Ability to operate independently, demonstrate creativity and outcome driven. Able to work with ambiguity.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills. Able to work with diverse range of corporate and research service partners.

job_description:
The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist to champion the efforts to drive a cohesive data integration and analytics . The solutions may be in the areas of structured or unstructured data. Depending on the area(s) of professional competencies, the ideal candidate will be tasked to develop the predictive, forecasting or operation research (optimisation) models as part of a larger effort. In addition, the role may be involved in text mining and network analytics solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for applying the skills and knowledge gained about data analysis, analytics, data science to ensure the successful delivery of client engagements and initiatives within our Data and Analytics practice.
  • Assist in collecting/gathering requirements from the clients to understand their current state.
  • Assist in developing proposals for business pursuits or opportunities.
  • Attend and assist in facilitating project meetings/workshops with client working team members.
  • Contribute and support projects in his/her respective area of expertise.
  • Produce high quality deliverables/document, with-ready-to-use content.
  • Drive a module or task within a project on their own with minimal supervision.
  • Prepare user requirements and any data development work including documentation.
  • Proactively perform research on the business, industry and functional domain of the client to stay up to date.
  • Assist in developing project deliverables and assets such as templates, processes, reports, and presentation decks for the client based on the work assigned.

The role of the Senior Data Scientist:

  • Proactively lead/contribute and support projects in his/her respective area of expertise.
  • Lead a small team of Data Scientists.
  • Lead the clients’ discussion for design, development and testing of enhancements spanning multiple areas ranging from moderate to high complexity.
  • End-to-end development of analytical models / data mining projects using SPSS, SAS, R, Python (or similar products).
  • Preferred industry: Finance/Banking, Healthcare, Transportation, Logistics
  • Drive projects of small-sized on his/her own with supervision.
  • Able to present his/her area of expertise confidently.
  • Proactively lead/contribute and support projects in his/her respective area of expertise. 

Requirements:

  • At least Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or equivalent.
  • Data Scientist – 1- 2 years’ experience; Senior Data Scientist – minimum 4 years and above.
  • Experienced in applying Analytics in the following functional domain areas:
  • Human Resources (attrition prediction, performance management, workforce optimisation, etc).
  • Sales and Marketing (Behaviour segmentation and profile, propensity modelling, campaign optimisation, marketing optimisation, etc).
  • Finance and Operations (sales or demand forecast, inventory optimisation, logistic optimisation, equipment predictive maintenance, contact centre analytics, etc).
  • Risk and Compliance (procurement compliance, fraud, event and behaviour detection and prediction).
  • Proficient in programming language like Python, R, SQL                
  • Applied machine learning background such as classification, clustering, anomaly detection, etc.
  • Strong mathematical background (linear algebra, probability and statistics, etc)   
  • Successful use of software engineering best practices, including version control (Git, Mercurial), unit testing and working with Agile delivery principles.                       
  • Deep and eager interest in emerging technologies and the ability to leverage the technologies into the solution to meet our strategic and operational client needs.
  • Able to develop SQL queries and working with data models.
  • A self-starter with an analytical approach to problem solving.
  • A client-centric, outcome driven and quality focused team player.

company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Data Engineering Lead, (AI Industrialization), Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD22949)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
The role is responsible for growing and leading the highly skilled multi-disciplined teams that deliver technology and analytics solution for the Bank, to drive DBS’s ambition to become a data-driven bank, leveraging insights generated using AI.
This is a key technology role to drive the aggressive agenda to create the capabilities on the Enterprise Data Platform to enable DBS to provide superior client experience through hyper-personalisation and 360 degree understanding of our customers using data and machine learning as well as other use cases from a fraud, risk and compliance perspective
The platform is an integrated solution providing data ingestion, data compute, data security, data governance, data quality, data visualization and end-to-end model lifecycle, using open sourced technology. The core practice is one of Agile, leveraging cloud native architecture pattern using Test Driven Development (TDD), continuous integration/continuous delivery, in an on-premise or public-cloud environment, where everything is automated. 
Responsibilities:
  • Manage the technology teams 30 - 50+ data engineers based in Singapore and Hyderabad responsible for building and supporting the enterprise data and analytics platform
  • Drive technical vision, technology stack selection and R&D of emerging technologies as it relates to big data and artificial intelligence
  • Strong technical competence to architect and manage big data, distributed computing and models development: Coding skills (such as Python, Java, R), experience performing analysis with large datasets, analytics tools experience
  • Skilled at condensing analysis into actionable insights to inform business decisions within marketing, and influence / transform business performance; understand business models and high level strategy
  • Resource planning, recruitment and key talent development
  • Partner with relevant Big Data, AI/ML vendors to supplement the open-sourced based solution as relevant
Required Experience and Skills:
  • At least 10+ years of relevant hands-on application development experience of mission critical data systems from scratch, including experience in Data Analytics and Business Intelligence 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Prior hands-on development experience working with Big Data and machine learning technologies such as the Hadoop ecosystem, YARN, Hive, HBase,  Zookeeper, HDFS, Spark, Presto, Superset, Kubeflow, MLFlow, H2o.ai, AWS Sagemaker, Google BigQuery, TensorFlow, Kafka etc. Experience in Cloudera suite of products and AWS/GCP Data /ML suite of products will be an added advantage 
  • Experience leading development team to build mission critical data applications from scratch
  • Strong architecture and technical skills in the Data and ML domains
  • Experience in AIOps and DataOps will be an added advantage
  • Strong communications skills with ability to work with individuals from multiple domains, from product owners to 3rd party partners
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively in a fast paced environment
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • A technologist’s technologist - able to lead high performance technology teams by example
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

company_overview:
Established in 1977, Crestar Education Group (CEG) is a leading provider of infant and child care services, preschool education, enrichment and adult education programmes in the region. Our Early Childhood Education & Care Services are offered through 4 brands: Kinderland, ELFA, NurtureStars and Skool4kidz, with the former two enjoying strong regional presence.
Our Enrichment brands under Crestar Learning Centre, Crestar School of Dance and Chinese Bridge Language School offer programmes in Art, Abacus, Maths, Music, Speech & Drama, Dance and Chinese Language to enhance learning experiences outside school.
As a part of our mission to promote lifelong learning, we provide continuing education and training through our Adult Education arm, KLC International Institute (KLCII). KLCII ranks among the region’s leading institutions for the training of preschool and child care teachers, offering academic certification from certificate to diploma level.
CEG is officially appointed by the Office of Chinese Language Council International (Hanban), Beijing, to administer the International Chinese Proficiency Test (HSK) and the Youth Chinese Test (YCT) in Singapore.
Collaboration with the Chinese National Language Committee Putonghua Training and Assessment Centre (Beijing), also give KLCII, our adult education division, the exclusive rights to conduct the Putonghua Shuiping Ceshi (PSC) locally.
We also form strategic partnership with businesses such as JACPA, Japan’s biggest name in sports education for pre-schoolers, to further enhance our education quality.

company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.

job_description:
About the Role
A leading global system integrator, looking for an experienced Power BI Consultant with strong experience in Tableau, Power BI, Data Warehouse, Data Modelling, and Data Visualisation on Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure/ GCP). You will be responsible to design, develop and implement Business Intelligence and Analytics systems. You will report directly to the Head of Department.
Job Description
  • Provide expertise in design, development and implementation of Business Intelligence (BI) and analytics systems.
  • Design and model the data warehouse systems, and develop BI reporting and analysis applications.
  • Provide optimal and cost-effective solutions to business teams in achieving business objectives.
  • Provide functional and technical guidance to business teams when needed.
  • Conduct business meetings with customers to determine project requirements and milestones.
  • Participate in the full life cycle of development, from specification and design through implementation, testing, and support.
  • Develop knowledge on business intelligence skills and processes.
  • Develop best practices to achieve project objectives and deliverables.
  • Develop positive working relationship with customers and other department staffs.
  • Stay updated with ongoing business developments and latest market trends.
  • Create a repository of the BI research results and findings.
  • Responsible for any other ad hoc duties assigned.
Requirements
  • Diploma/ Bachelor in Computer Science /Information Technology or relevant field.
  • At least 5 years of relevant working experience in relevant field and role within data-related or business intelligence position. 
  • Solid working experience in Tableau and Power BI development best practices, performance optimization, system tuning and design, and support.
  • Strong working experience in Data Warehouse, Data Modelling and Data Visualisation on Azure/ AWS/ Google Cloud Platform. 
  • Strong proficiency in SQL (ANSI) with proven ability to write complex freehand SQL including sub-queries, nested queries and other advanced SQL features. 
  • Proven experience with development and scripting in Java, Object-Oriented Languages, Python or any of the major languages to build robust data pipelines and dynamic systems.
  • Strong passion in data, and able to work with large data sets. 
  • Passionate in IT and keen to learn new technologies and methodologies with minimum supervision. 
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, presentation and time management skills.
  • A desire to thrive in a hard-working, fast-paced and collaborative team.
  • Great communicator, negotiator and team-player.
About the Company
Our client offers the benefits of a work environment that is stimulating and challenging. Located in the Central, you will enjoy working in a cohesive environment, with up-to-date technology, competitive package and opportunity for growth.
Interest & Apply
Interested applicants please send your resume to cv_janice@goodjobcreations.com.sg with your current resume and expected salary for a confidential discussion.

company_overview:
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.
Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.
Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.
Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.
job_description:
Job Responsibilities

This role is to deliver global Trade and FSCM Technology platform, managing the quality of functional delivery and ensuring the implementation of agreed functional capability.

  • As part of the Trade Transformation delivery team, the position will be responsible for the delivery of Global Trade and FSCM Technology platform, managing the quality of functional delivery and ensuring the implementation of agreed functional capability
  • Contribute to building expertise by mentoring, guiding and training as appropriate 
  • Functional lead for the roll-out of multi-country programs, working closely with vendor Delivery team and internal stakeholders across implementation, technology, FSCM on-boarding teams
  • Working closely with stakeholders to develop practical domain roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while taking into account business, technical and delivery constraints
  • Analyzing stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities
  • Reviewing problem ticket and incident to propose short term and long term resolution to fit with the domain roadmap
  • Guiding and challenge the project on functional architecture, design decision and performance testing

job_description:
Principal Business Process Analyst, Digitalization & Automation Technology (DAT)

Job Purpose:

This role will be responsible for ensuring the business processes in P+F Operations are digitalized and automated to achieve the company's vision to be Smart + Integrated manufacturing. The end goals of this initiative is to have a seamless, integrated, profitable and capable operational processes. 

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Analyse current business processes and MIS Systems and develop proposals to make it digitalized and automated
  • Drive improvements to the business processes before developing automation and or digitalization
  • Responsible for developing “functional requirements and specifications” to enable the Digitalization and Automation of “Operational processes in P+F Manufacturing”
  • Conduct a feasibility study, define solution alternatives, build consensus, and obtain sign-off from business users
  • Analyse and design detailed functional requirements and prepare development specifications
  • Develop systematic procedures and plans for Process & System analysis for Digitalization + Automation
  • Responsibility for compliance with the agreed performance targets of business process efficiency, business process flow, visualization requirements and data base requirements for projects in the area of Digitalized Automation Technology
  • Discuss for development of Programs / Applications based on defined specifications with IT team/Software vendor
  • Responsible for integration of developed solutions (Programs/Applications) in to the Business Processes and release to go Live with end user
  • Be an expert to define Digitalized + Automated Business Processes in P+F Manufacturing
  • Participation in the standardization of business processes and procedures in the group of companies in the area of Digitalization and Automation
  • Development of DAT / operational employees regarding the processing of DAT projects, business processes and technological background

Role Requirements:

  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, or other related discipline
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in process documentation, business analysis for manufacturing industry
  • Excellent understanding of IT software, ERP, MIS, Shop Floor, WMS (systems) and best practices
  • Knowledge of Software developer & testing Supply base would be highly regarded
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Focus on innovation: approaching problems in a different/refreshing manner to arrive at strong and new/different decisions or solutions
  • Quality focus: Understanding the processes and requirements of work and making sure that they deliver their intended outcomes to the customer (internal and external) on a consistent basis
  • A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to deal with conflict, to improvise and handling of unclear situations

job_title: VP/AVP, Specialist, Business Analyst, Middle Office Technology - (WD30103)
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
  • On a day to day basis provide support to the project team lead within the program. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring coordination of project activities and delivering of project deliverables. The candidates may be required to work across various projects within the program.
  • Gather and document business and technology requirements; data analysis
  • Define business processes & data flows
  • Work with system architects to define appropriate technology solutions
  • Document the necessary functional specifications for system development
  • Work closely with UX designer on clarifying requirements throughout the project life cycle
  • Act as an interface between development teams and business end users
  • Liaise with system developers through the system development life cycle to ensure common understanding
  • Assist in day to day project activities to ensure document, activities are monitored and completed on time
  • Support project managers to provide weekly status updates and track project schedule
  • Lead project streams and manage project finances when required
  • Manage change in requirements based on defined process
  • Plan, Participate and Coordinate test phases prior to implementation
  • Develop test plans against the functional specification
  • Execute functional testing of the new solution
  • Support various stages of testing, including UAT in preparation for production go-live
  • Assist preparation of training materials and user guide; conduct necessary training to users
  • Assist product owner in the development of user guides/manual
  • Assist in preparation of project review and closure documents
Requirements
  • Good understanding of banking domain
  • Experience in capturing business and technology requirements, systems development life cycle, writing functional specifications, writing test scripts and executing functional tests
  • Experience of working with different stakeholders
  • Either vendor systems or preferably an in-house solution
  • Ability to plan and conduct interviews with business end users on complex topics
  • A motivated self-starter with ability to multitask but requires minimal supervision to meet challenging targets, embody a `whatever it takes to get the job done` attitude
  • Able to operate independently and make sound decisions, but a team player with collaborative attitude and enjoys working in teams
  • Effective problem solving and analytical skills with attention to detail while maintaining a big picture outlook
  • Maintain high productivity in a fast paced environment showing effective prioritization skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proficient in MS Office and able to produce board-level documentation
  • Proficiency in some form of programming and database technology, such as Java, Oracle/Mysql/Mongodb etc…
  • Strong facilitation skills and experience facilitating workshops with large groups
  • Experience in various requirements models like use case models, business process models, data flow diagrams, context diagrams and sequence diagrams etc…
  • Experience in working with agile software development methodologies
  • Some skills in usage of any issue/problem tracking, defect management tool and MS SharePoint is required
  • Experience in working with multi location teams will be an added advantage

job_title: SVP, Data Scientist, Human Capital Analytics, Group Human Resources [WD27246]
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function
  • Group Human Resources has the important role of attracting, retaining, and nurturing talent to ensure that DBS continues to be a competitive employer in Asia. With a well-established team of HR partners, we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses.
  • Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people.
  • At DBS, data drives all of our decision-making, and Group Human Resources organisation is no exception.
  • We have been redefining human resources in the way we work closely with our management teams to attract, hire, develop and reward talented people that is reinventing the HR practice. 
  • The Human Capital Analytics team acts as an integral innovation lab, using diagnostic, advanced analytical approaches to making DBS a joyful place to come work, and is focused on bringing this discipline to the next level.
  • The team provides critical support to the business through surfacing people operation opportunities and solving challenges around organizational health, whereby we are not just taking the pulse of our people, but also harnessing their feedback to drive change for the better.
  • As a data-loving member of the team, you will use data, research and analytical insights to both build new and improve existing experimental Career Development, Learning and Talent Management activities.
  • Our Data Scientists in Human Capital Analytics are changing the way we design our employee journey through experimentations.
  • What we will love about you is that you are detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. Not only that, you are an exceptional problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who identifies the 'So what?' from data and insights you will be diving deep into, often wonders about the "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.
  • We are looking for someone who excels at diagnosing clients' needs and finding a way to satisfy them, has strong presentation skills and can lead a team to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Leaders in Data Science can see the different angles of a business opportunity or challenge, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions.
  • You have substantial leadership and hands-on experience with analytical tools and techniques, and you bring a solid skillset in analysing data and communicating recommendations.
  • You will leverage best practices and deepen your skillset by working with analytical thought leaders at the bank. In this role, you will develop HR domain knowledge and serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using a combination of facts, data and advanced analytical approaches to derive at informed, meaningful insights to help them make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.
Responsibilities 
You will lead a team of Data Scientists, and work with Business Intelligence Developers, Visualisation and Insights experts who partner with HR business partners and specialists to assess human capital needs and identify opportunities to apply data analytics.-    Define analytical strategy, problem statements and hypotheses to address identified opportunities, including analytical approaches, data and technology requirements
  • Develop predictive models and perform statistical analyses to identify key areas of risk and predict risk events, across a range of banking functions
  • Design and put in place tracking and feedback mechanisms to allow for capturing of actions and impact on business outcomes due to the implementation of analytics solutions
  • Present key findings to senior management and/or other stakeholders with actionable recommendations
  • Work with other data scientists and data translators to drive and operationalize analytical outputs.
 Requirements   
  • 10+ years of hands-on working experience, and of which, at least 8 years of relevant experience in an analytical function building and implementing various statistical models, working with large amounts of data and articulating business questions, data extraction and use of statistical approaches to arrive at an answer.
  • Mathematical problem formulation skills.
  • Deep understanding of mathematical and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) modeling techniques. An ability to translate business problems into mathematical formulations. Proficient with data manipulation and analysis. Ability to approach data in creative ways and from different angles for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling.
  • Experience in building and operationalizing the analytical capability.
  • Programming experience in R, Python, Spark or other statistical software. Proficient in SQL. Proficient with Hadoop, Java, Python, SQL, Hive, and/or MariaDB.
  • Experience working with unstructured datasets with knowledge in text mining and text analysis is preferred.Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of statistics, measurement and model evaluation.
  • Distinctive problem solving skills and impeccable business judgment.
  • Capable of translating complex modeling and analysis results into recommendations in a manner accessible by non-statisticians. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience working in a horizontal/cross-functional organization.
  • Independent self-starter with ability to multi-task and has a 'can-do' attitude.
Note: Candidates with lesser experience may be considered for a lower level position.
Apply Now
  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview:
Yishun Health is a network of medical institutions and health facilities in the north of Singapore, under the National Healthcare Group. It comprises Admiralty Medical Centre, Khoo Teck Puat Hospital and Yishun Community Hospital. It also includes community extensions such as Wellness Kampung.
With innovation in our corporate DNA and an international award winning Global Workplace Healthcare programme for our staff, there are many valued opportunities for you to grow with us. Take up one of these roles to redefine care with us, the Yishun Health way!
Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH), a 795-bed general and acute care hospital, opened in June 2010. Serving more than 550,000 people living in the northern sector of Singapore, KTPH combines medical expertise with high standards of personalised care, set within a healing environment, to provide care that is good enough for our own loved ones.
From intuitive wayfinding to logical clustering of services, KTPH's design is focused on providing a comfortable and hassle-free experience for patients. The building has garnered numerous awards for its green and energy efficient design, with wards that have views of greenery and naturally cool air. KTPH also provides a wide range of outpatient specialist services.
KTPH is part of Yishun Health, a network of medical institutions and health facilities under the National Healthcare Group in the north of Singapore, which also includes Admiralty Medical Centre, Yishun Community Hospital and extensions such as Wellness Kampung.
Vision
Adding years of healthy life.
Mission

Provide good quality, affordable and hassle-free healthcare with science, love and wisdom.
Our Care Philosophy
Care that is good enough for our own mothers without making special arrangements.
job_description:
We are looking for Senior Biostatistician to join us. This role will be required to provide biostatistics support in clinical epidemiology and health services research.
Working closely with the investigators in study-design, sample size / power calculation and formulating statistics analysis plan.
  • Conduct analysis in setting-up dataset according to research questions.
  • Analyse prospective epidemiological data and health services research data.
  • Support investigators in literature review, preparation of scientific publications and research grants.
  • Regularly conduct training courses in biostatistics as well as Supervise and mentor biostatistician
  • Keep abreast of and advise on the latest statistical techniques and tools.
Quality Improvement
  • Regularly perform rigorous quality checks to ensure the integrity, accuracy and completeness of data with various databases.
  • Embrace continuous improvements as our way of life by improving and refining work performance on a daily basis.
  • Contribute actively to department’s Kaizen or other service quality improvement projects and initiative.
Others
  • Perform other duties assigned by Reporting Officer.
  • Adhere to Hospital and Department policies and procedures.
REQUIREMENTS
  • Master’s degree (or higher) in Statistics, Biostatistics or Mathematics with strong statistical content. Candidate with PhD and work experience will be an added advantage. 
  • Preferably with track record of productive research in the life sciences, evidenced by peer-reviewed publication record. 
  • Experience in handling high-dimensional data, statistical analysis within academic clinical research or the pharmaceutical industry.
  • Competent with common statistical software and programmes (e.g. SAS, STATA, R and SPSS). 
  • Programming experience with SAS or R.
  • Experience in using biostatistics to analyze prospective epidemiological data and health services research data.
  • Ability to present results orally as well as in writing to non-statisticians.
  • Ability to work in an environment with tight timelines and multiple priorities.

job_description:

REQUIREMENTS
  • Currently pursuing a degree with relevant business discipline, e.g. Business, Economics, Strategy, Mathematics, or Engineering.

Benefits:

  • Employee financial and physical well-being
  • Compensation: you will receive a monthly base salary and CPF or ExPF contributions when you intern with StashAway.
  • Expatriate Pension Fund (ExPF): this employer-matching plan is made available via StashAway WorkPlace if you are a full-time or intern expatriate employed with our Singapore office.
  • Management fee discount: you will receive an employee discount on your asset management fees when you invest with StashAway. 
  • Flexible work arrangements and policies
  • Work-from-home policy: you may choose to work from home or the office depending on what works best for you and your team. We highly encourage you to come to the office to have a more fulfilling experience, building stronger connections with your team and other departments.
  • Personal work equipment budget: it’s important that you have a workstation that’s optimal for you wherever you are. 
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • L&D budget: you will be given a SGD 250 budget to help you continuously learn in your pursuit of your professional and personal development. You may use the budget for resources and tools that may help you perform better at work.
  • Team bonding budget and initiatives
  • Quarterly team bonding budget: we encourage you to socialize with colleagues across job functions, departments, and entities to know them better as individuals beyond what they professionally do.
  • Bi-annual off-sites (once in Apr and Oct): each off-site gathers all employees for a full day of company-wide team bonding activities and challenges.

company_overview:
Frasers Property Limited (“Frasers Property” and together with its subsidiaries, the “Frasers Property Group” or the “Group”), is a multi-national developer-owner-operator of real estate products and services across the property value chain.  Listed on the Main Board of the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (“SGX-ST”) and headquartered in Singapore, the Group has total assets of approximately S$40.3 billion as at 30 September 2021. 

Frasers Property's multi-national businesses operate across five asset classes, namely, residential, retail, commercial & business parks, industrial & logistics as well as hospitality. The Group has businesses in Southeast Asia, Australia, Europe and China, and its well-established hospitality business owns and/or operates serviced apartments and hotels in over 70 cities and 20 countries across Asia, Australia, Europe, the Middle East and Africa. 

Frasers Property is also the sponsor of two real estate investment trusts (“REITs”) and one stapled trust listed on the SGX-ST. Frasers Centrepoint Trust and Frasers Logistics & Commercial Trust are focused on retail, and industrial & commercial properties, respectively. Frasers Hospitality Trust (comprising Frasers Hospitality Real Estate Investment Trust and Frasers Hospitality Business Trust) is a stapled trust focused on hospitality properties. In addition, the Group has two REITs listed on the Stock Exchange of Thailand. Frasers Property (Thailand) Public Company Limited is the sponsor of Frasers Property Thailand Industrial Freehold & Leasehold REIT, which is focused on industrial & logistics properties in Thailand, and Golden Ventures Leasehold Real Estate Investment Trust, which is focused on commercial properties.

The Group is committed to inspiring experiences and creating places for good for its stakeholders. By acting progressively, producing and consuming responsibly, and focusing on its people, Frasers Property aspires to raise sustainability ideals across its value chain, and build a more resilient business. It is committed to be a net-zero carbon corporation by 2050. Building on its heritage as well as leveraging its knowledge and capabilities, the Group aims to create lasting shared value for its people, the businesses and communities it serves. Frasers Property believes in the diversity of its people and are invested in promoting a progressive, collaborative and respectful culture.
job_description:
Position Objective
Provide analytical, research and strategic support to the Portfolio Manager in the management of properties owned by FLT, including asset specific and portfolio analysis, property valuations, strategic evaluation of prospective new leases and research. Ensure that the portfolio and asset specific analysis, metrics and reporting requirements are continually updated and improved.
Duties and Responsibilities
Financial Analysis
  • Ensure databases (Argus and Master Data Files) are accurate and reconciled to source data such as leases, valuation reports, tenancy schedules, etc.
  • Undertake analysis of the FLT portfolio and prepare metrics (WALE, age, cap rate, rental increments, etc).
  • Assist in financial modelling for potential leases, of a material nature, to help determine the attractiveness to the FLT portfolio.
  • Assist in the formulation and feasibility analysis of Asset Enhancement Initiatives (“AEI”).
  • Assist in the preparation and compilation of Strategic Asset Plans (“SAP”) for the FLT portfolio on an annual basis.
  • Assist with the preparation of approval papers, reports and presentations to the Manager and Trustee of FLT, the Board, investors and those for internal distribution.
  • Ensure the timely preparation of any management reports required with a consistent format to fulfil reporting requirements of the business.
Valuations
  • Involved in coordinating independent valuations on an as needs basis.
  • Provide constructive comments on reviews of valuation reports that are received from external valuers.
  • Be able to model property cash flows and valuations in Argus Enterprise that are accurate and reliable for adoption and reporting.
Research
  • Provide research on the economy and property market.
  • Maintain a database to track sales and leasing transactions.
  • Assist in preparing market outlook for each submarket (demand & supply dynamics, new developments, rents, yields, incentives, vacancy, etc).
  • Establish and drive research capability in house, including maintaining databases and financial information relevant to both FLT and competitors.
Key Stakeholders
Internal
  • Senior Management
  • Portfolio Managers
  • Asset Managers
  • Investment Managers
  • Property Analysts
  • Property Managers
  • Leasing Managers
  • Finance Team
  • Internal Audit
External
  • Leasing and investment agents
  • Valuers
Competencies, Qualifications, Attributes & Experience
Competencies
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Excel.
  • Modelling experience with Argus Enterprise would be considered an advantage.
  • An understanding of property valuation methodologies is a distinct advantage.
  • Understanding of logistics and industrial assets and markets is a distinct advantage.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective relationships.
Qualifications
  • Tertiary qualification in real estate/finance/investment, valuations or other discipline providing skills applicable to property investment and management.
  • Valuation qualification would be considered an advantage.
Experience
  • Professional experience that clearly demonstrates an intrinsic knowledge and understanding of the property investment market.  This may have been gained in agency, valuations, a development role, with a fund manager or as a consultant.
  • Strong financial analytical skills and a desire to develop new techniques for property investment management. 
  • Direct valuation experience (~5 years) is a distinct advantage.
Attributes
  • A desire to develop financial analytical skills and have passion for numbers.
  • Self-motivated with a “can do” attitude.
  • A desire to gain a board and varied knowledge of the business by taking on new challenges and a variety of tasks.
  • Common sense approach to problem solving.
  • A willingness to contribute ideas, views and expertise .
  • Ability to work on several different matters and frequently reprioritise.
  • Ability to collaborate with varying levels of internal staff and a range of external personnel.
  • Reliable and dedicated member with a strong commitment to ethical behaviours.
Our Diversity brings us closer to the communities we serve.
Guided by our Purpose, we are creating, inspiring and nurturing an inclusive culture that unlocks the power of diverse teams to drive Frasers Property forward. Our values drive everything we do, which are core to creating safe places where everyone belongs, is mutually respected and feels empowered to be authentic at work. Working collaboratively makes us progressively stronger and better as an organisation, which helps our people to thrive day to day.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
VP / AVP, Business Analyst (Avaloq), Consumer Banking Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD23121)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Job PurposeAs a Business System Analyst (BSA), you will be responsible for developing technical solutions to business problems. This usually begins with defining, analysing and documenting the requirements. Managing requirements at the project level can help fulfil business needs. Solutions often include a software-systems development component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development. The candidate should value simplicity and impact, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and have the ability and desire to learn. Candidate also require having greater flexibility, greater discipline, and the willingness to work in an evolutionary manner.
Key Accountabilities
  • Work with business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business process, establishing project scope and goals.
  • Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure requirements are clear and delivered successfully.
  • Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure solution design is optimized for efficiency.
  • Facilitate conflict resolution and be able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective.
  • Develop, execute and manage the project plan, and take corrective actions when project deviates from plan.
  • Coordinate with business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases.
  • Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues.
  • Initiate User Requests (Request for Service) for enhancements on behalf of the business.
Responsibilities
  • Bridge the communication between the development team and business stakeholders, by providing the details explaining the requirements to the team.
  • To identify stakeholder needs, negotiate priorities between repeating stakeholder factions, and then collaborate with developers to ensure that the requirements are implemented effectively. 
  • Provide clarity in business requirement to allow developers to provision estimates, and serve to represent stakeholders, to provide business priorities.
  • Act as an SME in the respective domain with sufficient knowledge to interact, solicit requirements, and advise business users on the best solutions
  • Help develop compelling and innovative solutions while complying with existing standards, guidelines, and processes
  • Perform end-to-end technical impact analysis and lead the requirement gathering with business users. Propose alternate solutions to meet or improve the desired objectives based on best practices and industry solutions and influence the desired outcomes
  • Verify that the user requirements are achievable and support business users during UAT and post-implementation phases
  • Effectively translate user stories/ pain points into technical specification details and collaborate with various development teams to produce high quality deliverables
  • Review test cases and help resolve requirement/implementation issues during testing phase
  • Perform Proof of concept before project inception
Requirements
  • Must have the ability to investigate and understand how the business works.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and specify requirements to solve business problems.
  • Ability to facilitate and elicit requirements.
  • Significant and solid understanding of software development life cycle. 
  • Demonstrable experience of ability to identify the business needs of stakeholders who will be impacted by the change and understand their influence and authority. Significant and demonstrable experience of RDBMS
  • Experience in facilitation skills for requirement workshop planning, ability to manage requirements during requirement change management. 
  • Understand conduct interface analysis, the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.
  • At least 5-7 years + of development or system design working experience
  • Proven experience of having solved complex analytical and technical problems
  • Strong analytical skills and proven ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex analytical outcomes, linkages and messages
  • Strong business and technology knowledge on Wealth product offering and processes
  • Strong team player and interpersonal skills
  • Self-starter and motivated
  • Ability to perform technical impact analysis independently and resourceful in finding information required
  • Strong believe in doing the right thing in offering solutions
  • Ability to multi-task and effectively organize him/herself to achieve the objective
  • Proficient with various tools for collaboration and issue management as well as agile software and development
  • Prior experience and technical knowledge on Avaloq is a must
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
